Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis), due to increase of its concentrations and of those of its active metabolite
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the treatment with the two medications together.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the fluconazole by increase of its metabolism by the rifampacin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the rivaroxaban by the fluconazole, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of the half life of the sulfonamide with possible onset of hypoglycemia
Comment: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the sulfonamide during the treatment with the fluconazole.

Description: Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose (decrease of the clearance of the theophylline)
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the fluconazole and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)
Comment: More frequent CBC

Description: Increase of the risk of pulmonary toxicity that could be fatal.
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the fluoroquinolone and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
Comment: Take the iron salts at a different time from the fluoroquinolones (more that 2 hours apart if possible).

Description: Possible increase of the risk of tendinitis, even of rupture of the tendon (exceptional), particularly in patients receiving prolonged corticotherapy
Decrease of the concentrations of the mycophenolic acid by about a third, with potential risk of reduction of effectiveness.
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the strontium
Comment: Take the strontium at a different time from the fluoroquinolones (more than two hours apart if possible).

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
Comment: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the fluoroquinolone (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
Comment: Take the zinc salts at a different time from the fluoroquinlones (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

Description: Strengthening of the effects, both cytostatic and undesirable, of the fluorouracil.
Large increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: If taking these medications together cannot be avoided, more frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cytotoxic and a week after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the gastrointestinal toxicity of the fluorouracil
Increase of the toxicity of the fluourouracil due to decrease of its clearance
Increase of the toxicity of the fluorouracil due to decrease of its clearance
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
Comment: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine, and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the serotoninergic antidepressant and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzymatic inhibitor
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol, especially with excessive bradycardia, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the fluoxetine.
Comment: Increased clinical monitoring, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of themetoprolol during the length of the treatment with the fluoxetine and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the nebivolol, especially with excessive bradycardia, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the antidepressant
Comment: Increased clinical monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the nebivolol during the length of the treatment with the antidepressant and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of the metabolism of the phenytoin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. If needed, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with the fluoxetine and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the active fraction of the risperidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluoxetine, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
Comment: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the risperidone.

Description: Reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the fluoxetine.
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the vortioxetine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the treatment with fluoxetine and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the concentrations of agomelatine, with risk of increase of the undesirable effects.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
Comment: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the serotoninergic antidepressant and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of clozapine with signs of overdose
Comment: Increased clinical monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the clozapine during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the duloxetine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluvoxamine
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine with possibilities of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (decrease of the hepatic clearance of the lidocaine)
Comment: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine during and after the administration of the two substances together. Adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the lidocaine.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of methodone with overdose and increased risk of lengthening of the QT interval and of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: Strengthen clinical monitoring and EKG; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the methadone during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mexiletine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the fluvoxamine
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG. Adjustment of the dosage of the mexiletine during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the concentrations of the olanzapine, with risk of increase of the undesirable effects, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluvoxamine
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the olanzapine during the treatment with fluvoxamine.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the phenytoin during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of pirfenidone with signs of overdose
Increase of the plasma concentrations of propranolol due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of the activity and of the undesirable effects, for example: significant bradycardia
Comment: Increased clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propranolol during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the concentrations of ropinirole, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluvoxamine
Comment: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the ropinirole during the treatment with fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the theophyllinemia with signs of overdose (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the theophylline)
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the phenobarbital, due to increase of its metabolism of which the folates represent one of the cofactors
Comment: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations, and adjustment, if there is reason for it, of the dosage of the phenobarbital during the folic supplementation and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin due to increase of its metabolism of which the folates represent one of the cofactors
Comment: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the phenytoin during the folic supplementation and after it is stopped.

Drug 2 Class Name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)
Description: Risk of hyperkalemia, renal insufficiency, increase of mortality due to cardio vascular disease
Comment: -for patients with diabetes or renal insufficiency

Description: The plasma concentrations of aliskiren increase by nearly 5 times and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects.
Risk of hyperkalemia, of renal insufficiency, of increase of mortality from cardio vascular disease
Comment: -for patients with diabetes or renal insufficiency

Description: The plasma concentrations of aliskiren increase by nearly 6 times and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects.
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the aliskiren when grapefruit is consumed
Increase of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects.
With patients who have diabetes or renal insufficiency, increase of the undesirable effects such as hypotension, hyperkalemia
Increase of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects.
Comment: Clinical monitoring

Description: Risk of increase or of decrease of the effects of the A to take into account buprenorphine [sic], simultaneously by inhibition and acceleration of its metabolism by the protease inhibitor
Risk of lower effectiveness of the amprenavir.
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

Description: Significant decrease of the concentrations of amprenavir that can lead to a loss of viralogical response
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ampernavir
Comment: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

Description: Risk of lower effectiveness of the amprenavir
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

Description: Risk of severe hypocalcemia
Comment: Monitoring of the calcemia and supplementation if necessary.

Description: With the dacarbazine in large doses: risk of pulmonary toxicity (adult acute respiratory distress syndrome ).
Comment: Do not use these medications simultaneously, but wait a week between the last administration of fotemustine and the first day of the treatment with dacarbazine.

Description: Decrease of the diuretic effect which can reach 50%
Comment: Possibly use higher doses of furosemide.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the didanosine, and especially the mitochondrial toxicity, due to substantial increase of its concentrations. In addition, risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ganciclovir due to decrease of its concentrations, if the two medications are ingested in an interval of less than 2 hours
Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two medications together.

Description: Increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)
Comment: Stop the zidovudine temporarily; CBC, and, reintroduce, if possible, the zidovudine in small doses.

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the dasabuvir by the gemfibrozil
Increase of the active fraction of the enzalutamide
Comment: Reduce the dose of enzalutamide by half when administered with the gemfibrozil.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the glitazone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the gemfibrozil
Comment: If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring.

Description: Risk of severe hypoglycemia, even coma, due to substantial increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide by the gemfiborzil

Risk of reduced effectiveness of the glibenclamide due to decrease of its plasma concentrations, because of the inducer effect of the bosentan. Furthermore, cases of hepatoxicity have been reported with these substances administered together.
Comment: Monitoring of the glycemia, adjustment of the treatment if needed, and monitoring of the hepatic biological constants

Description: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic
Comment: Inform the patient, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the clarithromycin

Description: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic
Comment: Inform the patient, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the erythromycin.

Description: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic.
Comment: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the clarithromycin

Description: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic
Comment: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the erythromycin.

Description: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
Comment: Inform the patient, and, especially at the beginning of treatment, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose

Description: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
Comment: Inform the patient, and reinforce, especially at the beginning of treatment, self-monitoring of blood glucose.

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the glipizide at the origin of potentially severe hypoglycemia.
Comment: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during and after the treatment with voriconazole.

Description: Increase of the effect of the Vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage (decrease of its hepatic metabolism)
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the allopurinol and a week after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of didanosine and of its undesirable effects
Increased risk of cutaneous reactions
Increased risk of neurological disorders (trembling, confusion) due to partial inhibition of the metabolism of the antiviral
All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
Comment: Inform the patient and, especially at the beginning of treatment, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose

Description: Increase of the risk of the onset of angioedema, due to the reduction of the activity of the enzyme dipetidyl peptidase-4 (DDP-4) by the gliptin, in patients treated with the angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor
Excessive immunodepression with risk of lymphoproliferative disorders (LPDs)
Risk of possibly fatal general illness. This risk is increased in older patients already immunodepressed by the underlying disease.
Comment: In particular, use an inactivated vaccine when one exists (poliomyelitis)

Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: -anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1gr per dose and/or >=3 gr per day)

Description: Glucocorticoids (general and rectal routes): possible impact of the corticotherapy on the metabolism of the Vitamin K antagonist and on that of the factors of coagulation. Risk of hemorrhage specific to the corticotherapy (digestive mucosa, vascular fragility) in large doses or in treatment prolonged beyond 10 days.
Comment: When administering substances from these groups together is justified, strengthen monitoring: if the situation requires, with the vitamin K antagonists, biological testing on the 8th day, then every two weeks after that during the corticotherapy and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the inducer: the consequences are particularly great with patients who have Addisons disease treated with hydrocortisone and in cases of organ transplants
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the risk of ulceration and of gastrointestinal hemorrhage
With the glucocorticoids by IV route: risk of severe myopathy, reversible after a possibly long period (several months).
Possible increase of the risk of tendinitis, even of rupture of the tendon (exceptional), particularly in patients receiving corticotherapy for a prolonged period

Described for prednisolone. Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the isoniazid. Mechanism proposed: increase of the hepatic metabolism of the isoniazid and decrease of that of the glucocorticoides
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin; the consequences are particularly great in patients with Addisons disease treated with hydrocortisone and in cases of transplants
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: With the exception of inhaled and local routes, and for doses greater than 10mg/day of prednisone-equivalent (or > 2mg/kg/day for a child or > 20mg/day for a child weighing more than 10 kg) during more than two weeks and for the "bolus" of corticoids: risk of possibly fatal general vaccine disease.
Comment: And during the 3 months following the end of the therapy with the corticoid.

Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the Vitamin K Antagonist

Description: Decrease of the lithemia with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
Comment: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

Description: Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the griseofulvin
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with griseofulvin and a week after it is stopped

Description: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type, should be used during the time the two substances are administered together and a cycle after.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the length of time these substances are administered together and a cycle following.

Description: With the guanethidine used by IV route: risk of unforeseeable vascular reactions, especially hypotension
Comment: Interrupt the treatment with the MAOI two weeks before the treatment with guanethidine.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If this is possible, interrupt the azole antifungal. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT interval before the beginning of the treatment and EKG monitoring

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If this is possible, interrupt the macrolide. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT interval before the beginning of the treatment and EKG monitoring

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If this is possible, interrupt the macrolide. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT interval before the beginning of the treatment and EKG monitoring

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If this is possible, interrupt the azole antifungal. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT interval before the beginning of the treatment and EKG monitoring

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Clinical monitoring and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with the carbamazepine and after it is stopped
Comment: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with the carbamazepine and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the haloperidol and of its therapeutic effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Drug 2 Class Name: BETA-2 MIMETICS or BETA2 ADRENERGIC AGONISTS
Description: In cases of obstetrical surgery, increased uterine inertia with risk of hemorrhage; furthermore serious ventricular arrhythmias, due to increase of the cardiac reactivity
Comment: Interrupt treatment with the beta-2 agonist if the anesthesia must be done with halothane

Description: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increase of cardiac sensitization
Increase of the hypotensive effect. Risk of severe orthostatic hypotension.
Increase of the hypotensive effect. Increased risk of orthostatic hypotension
Risk of orthostatic hypotension, especially in older patients
Comment: -with doxazosin

Description: Increased risk of hemorrhage
Accrued risk of hemorrhage

Comment: -anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1gr per dose and/or >=3 gr per day)

Drug 1 Class Name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENT)
Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: If the administration of these together cannot be avoided, strengthen clinical monitoring and, if the situation requires, biological monitoring.

Drug 1 Class Name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENT)
Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage (irritation of the gastroduodenal mucosa by the NSAIs)

Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage

Drug 1 Class Name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (PREVENTIVE DOSES)
Description: The combination of medications acting at different levels of hemeostasis increases the risk of bleeding. Thus, with patients under 65 years of age, adding heparin or similar substances in preventive doses to acetylsalicylic acid, whatever the dosage, must be taken into account by maintaining clinical and possibly biological monitoring.

Drug 1 Class Name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (PREVENTIVE DOSES)
Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage

Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage (inhibition of the platelet function and irritation of the gastroduodenal mucosa by the acetylsalicylic acid)
Comment: -anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1gr per dose and/or >=3 gr per day)

Drug 1 Class Name: UNFRACTIONATED HEPARIN (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENTS)
Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage (irritation of the gastroduodenal mucosa by the NSAIs)
Comment: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring.

Comment: When the heparin alternates with the vitamin K antagonist, strengthen clinical monitoring.

Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Risk of clinically low thyroid in patients with hypothyroidism, due to increase of the metabolism of the T3 and of the T4
Comment: Monitoring of the serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormones during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of absorption of the thyroid hormones
Comment: Take the calcium salts at a different time from the thyroid hormones (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

Description: Risk of clinical hypothyroidism in patients taking thyroid hormones in substitution therapy
Comment: Monitoring of the serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment of the dosage of the thyroid hormone if needed during the treatment with the antimalarial and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of clinical hypothyroidism in cases of estrogen substitution therapy
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring; possible adjustment of the doses of the thyroid hormone for menopausal women taking estrogens.

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the thyroid hormones
Comment: Take the thyroid hormones at a different time from the iron (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

Description: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the thyroid hormones
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the thyroid hormones due to the increase of their hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the thyroid hormones.

Description: Risk of disequilibrium of the thyroid replacement therapy in cases where there is treatment with orlistat
Risk of clinically low thyroid with patients having thyroid replacement therapy
Comment: Monitoring of the serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment if needed of the dosage of the thyroid hormone during the treatment with the antimalarial and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the thyroid hormones
Comment: Take the thyroid hormones at a different time from the resin (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

Description: Described for phenytoin, rifampicin, and carbamazepine. [sic]Risk of clinical hypothyroidism in patients with low thyroid, due to increase of the metabolism of the T3 and T4
Comment: Monitoring of the serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormones during the treatment with rifabutin and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of clinically low thyroid in patients with already low thyroid due to increase of the metabolism of the T3 and the T4.
Comment: Monitoring of serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment if needed of the dosage of the thyroid hormones during treatment with rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the thyroid hormones
Comment: Take the thyroid hormones at a different time from the sulcralfate (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

Description: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the thyroid hormones
Risk of rupture of the condom when used with lubricants containing mineral oils (paraffin oil, silicone oil, etc...)
Comment: Use hydrosoluble lubricants (glycerin, polyacrylamide...).

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the hydrocortisone (increase of its metabolism); the consequences are serious when the hydrocortisone is administered in replacement therapy or in case of transplants
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the hydrocortisone during the time it is taken with the enzymatic inducer and after the enzymatic inducer is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the hydroquinidine and risk of overdose (decrease of the renal excretion of the hydroquinidine due to alkalinizing of the urine )
Comment: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly testing of the concentrations of the hydroquinidine; if needed, adjustment of the dosage during the alkalinizing treatment and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the renal clearance of the digoxin. In addition, disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia and disorders of atrioventricular conduction).
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG. In the case of unexpected results, test the digoxinemia and adjust the dosage.

Description: Risk of tinnitis and/or loss of hearing acuity: cinchonism linked to a decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the antiarrythmic by the itraconazole
Comment: Monitoring of the plasma concentrations of the antiarrythmic and possible decrease of its dosage if necessary.

Description: When indicated for a patient with drepanocytosis (sickle cell anemia), theoretical risk of general fatal vaccine disease.
Comment: Administering these together should be considered only if the benefits are estimated to be higher than the this risk.

Description: With the vitamin E used in doses greater than or equal to 500 mg per day: increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with vitamin E and after it is stopped.

Description: With the metoprolol used in heart failure: risk of increase of the undesirable effects of metoprolol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the hydroxycloroquine
Comment: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the hydroxychloroquine

Description: Risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect of the hydroxychloroquine, due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hydroxychloroquine during the treatment with rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Drug 2 Class Name: SUBSTANCES THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES
Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: --with the citalopram, the domperidone, the escitalopram, the hydroxyzine and the piperaquine

Description: Risk of increase of hyperkalemia, potentially lethal.
Increase of central nervous system depression
Increased risk of hypokalemia
Comment: Monitoring of kalemia with correction if needed.

Description: Hypokaliemia that promotes the toxic effects of the digitalics.
Comment: Correct beforehand any hypokaliemia; maintain clinical monitoring, electrolite monitoring, and EKG.

Drug 2 Class Name: SUBSTANCES THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES
Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially torsades de pointes
Comment: Correct any hypokalemia before administering the product and maintain clinical monitoring, electrolyte monitoring and electrocardiographic monitoring.

Description: Increase of the risk of hyponatremia
Increase of the plasma concentrations of ibrutinib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the amiodarone
Comment: Strict clinical monitoring and reduction of the dose of ibrutinib to 140 mg per day during the length of time these medications are administered together.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of ibrutinib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem
Comment: Strict clinical monitoring and reduction of the dose of ibrutinib to 140 mg/day during the length of time these medications are administered together.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of irutinib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil
Comment: Strict clinical monitoring and reduction of the dose of ibrutinib to 140mg per day during the length of time these medications are administered together.

Description: Increase of the undesirable effects of the calcium channel blocker, of the orthostatic hypotension sort, especially with older patients
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the calcium channel blocker during the treatment with idelalisib and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentratioins of idelalisib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant enzymatic inducer
Increase of the plasma concentrations of idelalisib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Risk of large decrease of the plasma concentrations of idelalisib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Decease of the plasma concentrations of idelalisib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the substrate due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the idelalisib.
Risk of increase of the neurotoxicity of the ifosfamide
Risk of increase of the neurotoxicity of the ifosfamide due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenobarbital
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the ifosfamide, with increase of its active metabolite and increased toxicity
Increase of the hypertensive and/or hyperthermic effects of the tyramine present in certain alcoholic drinks (chianti, certain beers, etc.)
Comment: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages and medications containing alcohol.

Description: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increased cardiac sensitization.

Decrease of the plasma concentrations of itraconazole, with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer

Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the bitherapy due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer

Description: Increase of the pharmacological effects, and especially increase in blood pressure and contraction of the blood vessels, by the catecholamines due to the combined inhibition of their metabolism

Description: Risk of significant hypotension (synergic effect) capable of aggravating the state of myocardial ischemia and provoking an acute coronary accident

Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
Comment: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment.

Description: Risk of hyperkalemia, of renal insufficiency, of increase of mortality from cardiovascular disease

Description: In situations where the administration of these medications together is possible, increased risk of degradation of renal function, even acute renal insufficiency, and increase of the hyperkalemia as well as hypotension and fainting or loss of consciousness.

Acute renal insufficiency with patients at risk (older patients, dehydrated ones, those taking diuretics, those having altered renal function) due to decrease of the glomerular filtration (inhibition of the vasodilating prostaglandins due to the NSAIs). These effects are generally reversible. Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
Comment: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment and regularly during the administration of these substances together.

Drug 2 Class Name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)
Description: Risk of hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia producing effects)

Description: Risk of abrupt arterial hypotension and/or acute renal insufficiency at the start of or when there is an increase of the dosage of the treatment with the ACE inhibitor in cases of pre-existing fluid depletion
Comment: In arterial hypertension, when there is fluid depletion from a previous treatment with a diuretic, it is necessary:

Description: Increase of the risk of hyperkalemia, especially with older patients.
Comment: Strict testing of the kalemia and of renal function during the administration of these substances together.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the angioneurotic edema type (angioedema)
Increase of the risk of angioedema
Increase of the risk of the onset of angioedema, due to reduction of the activity of the enzyme dipetidyl peptidase-4 (DDP-4) by the gliptin, in patients treated with the ACE inhibitor

The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in a diabetic treated with insulin. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for insulin).
Comment: Reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose

Description: Increase of the lithemia which can reach toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium)
Comment: If the use of an ACE inhibitor is indispensable, strict monitoring of the lithemia and adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

Description: With the gold salts administered by IV route: risk of nitritoid reaction when the ACE inhibitor is introduced (nausea, vomiting, vasomotor effects of the flushing type, hypotension, possibly a drop in blood pressure)
Hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
Comment: Unless there is hypokalemia.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the angioedema type.
Comment: --in case of preceding angioedema with ACE inhibitors

Description: Increase of the risk of angiodema

With the spironolactone at dosages from 12.5 to 50 mg per day, and with low doses of ACE inhibitorsIn the treatment of class III or IV heart failure (NYHA) with an ejection fraction <35% and previous treatment with an ACE inhibitor + a loop diuretic: risk of hyperkalemia, potentially lethal, in case of failure to follow the prescribed doses for this combination of medications.
Comment: Verify the absence of pre-existing hyperkalemia and renal insufficiency. Strict biological monitoring of the kalemia and of the creatinemia (1 time per week during the first month, then one time per month thereafter).

Description: The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in diabetic patients treated with glucose lowering sulfonamides. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for the glucose lowering sulfonamides)
Comment: Reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose.

Description: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type.
Comment: Stop the treatment with the HMG Co-A reductase inhibitor before starting a treatment with fusidic acid or use another antibiotic

Description: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable muscular effects of these substances, and especially of rhabdomyolysis
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

Description: Risk of addition of the undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type.
Comment: If the administration of these medications together cannot be avoided, reinforce biological monitoring (dosage of the CPK more than once a week) and strict clinical monitoring.

Description: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the statins, due to inhibition of their hepatic recapture
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the statin.

Description: Risk of addition of undesirable effects (dose-dependent) of the rhabdomyolosis type. Furthermore, with the gemfibrozil, decrease of the metabolism of the simvastatin and of the rosuvastatin, which increases the muscular risk, as well as the nephrotoxicity of the rosuvastatin
Comment: --for doses of 40mg of rosuvastatin

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the statin and of its undesirable effects of the rhabdomyolosis type.
Comment: --with the rosuvastatin.

Description: Increased risk of the appearance of rhabdomyolysis
Comment: Reinforce clinical and biological monitoring, especially during the first weeks of treatment.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the protease inhibitor
Comment: It is recommended that that the protease inhibitor be administered as far from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

Description: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the ritonavir, with risk of reduction of its effectiveness.
Comment: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzymatic inducer and after it is stopped.

Drug 2 Class Name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE
Description: Risk of constriction of coronary blood vessels or those of the extremities (ergotism), or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

Description: Variation of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist, most often by decreasing it
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the length of the treatment

Description: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin)
Comment: Use weaker doses of atorvastatin. If the therapeutic objective is not reached, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

Description: Decrease, possibly very large, of the plasma concentrations of the atovaquone due to increase of its metabolism

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome, even of adrenal insufficiency
Decrease of the concentrations of the boceprevir and of the lopinavir (or darunavir or fosamprenavir), with risk of therapeutic failure
Risk of increase or decrease of the effects of the buprenorphine, due to both inhibition and acceleration of its metabolism by the protease inhibitor
Increase of the concentrations of the clarithromycin and of its active metabolite due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of treatment with these medications together.

Description: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, with potentially fatal consequences
Risk of edimumution [sic] of the effectiveness of the cyyproterone.
Comment: --in its use as a hormonal contraceptive: use instead another method ofcontraception in particular a barrier type, during the administration of these substances together and a cycle following

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia, more marked for IV route, due to increase of the absorption of the digoxin or decrease of its renal clearance.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia, with possible adjustment of the dosage of digoxin.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of eribuline by the ritonavir
Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to decrease of the concentrations of the hormonal contraceptive, because of the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir.
Comment: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type (condom or IUD), should be used during the length of the treatment with these medications together and a cycle following.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the thyroid hormones due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the thyroid hormones.

Description: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: If these substances are administered together, strict testing of the renal function, blood concentration dosages of the immunosuppressant, and adjustment of its dosage.

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentration of the ritonavir boosted protease inhibitor or of the CYP3A4 inhibitor.
Comment: To know the risks and levels of severity of each ritonavir boosted protease inhibitor taken with the strong inhibitors of CYP3A4, consult the specific authorization for sale to the public ("Authorisation de la Mise sur le Marche" a French document) for each one of them.

Description: Risk of increase of the concentrations of itraconazole by the protease inhibitor
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these together. Administering large doses of itraconazole (>200 mg per day) is not recommended.

Description: Risk of decrease of the concentrations and of the effectiveness of the lamotrigine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: -Avoid beginning the treatment with ritonavir during the period of adjustment of the dosage of lamotrigine

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation
Comment: - the midazolam IV and sublingual

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the protease inhibitor, due to the enzymatic inducer effect of the St Johns wort, with risk of reduction of effectiveness, even complete loss of the effect, which can have possibly serious consequences (reduction of the antiretroviral effectiveness)
Comment: In the case of the substances being taken together by accident, do not stop the St Johns wort abruptly, but test the plasma concentrations (or the effectiveness) of the protease inhibitor before and then after the St Johns wort is stopped.

Description: Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentrations of nintedanib due to increase of its absorption by the ritonavir boosted protease inhibitor
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these substances together.

Description: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness because of decrease of the concentrations of hormonal contraceptive, due to the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type (condom or IUD), should be used during the time the substances are administered together and one cycle following.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor (even more so when the dosage of the rifabutin is large) for one thing, and risk of increase of the undesirable effects (uveitis) of the rifabutin, for another thing.
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the protease inhibitor, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.For the combination (saquinavir + ritonavir):risk of severe hepatocellular toxicity
Comment: Until additional information about the ritonavir boosted protease inhibitors is available.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the rosuvastatin due to increase of its absorption
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolisis type (decrease of the hepatic metoblism of the simvastatin).
Decrease of the concentrations of the telaprevir and of the darunavir or of the fosamprenavir, with risk of therapeutic failure.
With the atazanavir, the darunavir or the lopinavir, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its aborption
Comment: In case of administration of these together, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day. The administration with the other protease inhibitors of HIV has not been studied.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the theophylline, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the protease inhibitor and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: Choose a therapeutic alternative that is little or not at all metabolized.

Description: Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor.
Comment: Strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antimitotic.

Description: Very large reduction of the concentrations of the antifungal due to increase of its metabolism by the ritonavir, with risk of failure of the treatment
Risk of facilitating systemic uptake of the aluminum salts especially when there is altered renal function
Comment: Take aluminum based gastrointestinal medications at a different time (more than 2 hours apart if possible) from the citrates, including the natural ones such as citrus fruits and juices.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the protease inhibitor
Comment: It is recommended that that the protease inhibitor be administered as far from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

Description: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the ritonavir, with risk of reduction of its effectiveness.
Comment: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzymatic inducer and after it is stopped.

Drug 2 Class Name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE
Description: Risk of constriction of coronary blood vessels or those of the extremities (ergotism), or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

Description: Variation of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist, most often by decreasing it
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the length of the treatment

Description: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin)
Comment: Use weaker doses of atorvastatin. If the therapeutic objective is not reached, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

Description: Decrease, possibly very large, of the plasma concentrations of the atovaquone due to increase of its metabolism

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome, even of adrenal insufficiency
Decrease of the concentrations of the boceprevir and of the lopinavir (or darunavir or fosamprenavir), with risk of therapeutic failure
Risk of increase or decrease of the effects of the buprenorphine, due to both inhibition and acceleration of its metabolism by the protease inhibitor
Increase of the concentrations of the clarithromycin and of its active metabolite due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of treatment with these medications together.

Description: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, with potentially fatal consequences
Risk of edimumution [sic] of the effectiveness of the cyyproterone.
Comment: --in its use as a hormonal contraceptive: use instead another method ofcontraception in particular a barrier type, during the administration of these substances together and a cycle following

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia, more marked for IV route, due to increase of the absorption of the digoxin or decrease of its renal clearance.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia, with possible adjustment of the dosage of digoxin.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of eribuline by the ritonavir
Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to decrease of the concentrations of the hormonal contraceptive, because of the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir.
Comment: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type (condom or IUD), should be used during the length of the treatment with these medications together and a cycle following.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the thyroid hormones due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the thyroid hormones.

Description: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: If these substances are administered together, strict testing of the renal function, blood concentration dosages of the immunosuppressant, and adjustment of its dosage.

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentration of the ritonavir boosted protease inhibitor or of the CYP3A4 inhibitor.
Comment: To know the risks and levels of severity of each ritonavir boosted protease inhibitor taken with the strong inhibitors of CYP3A4, consult the specific authorization for sale to the public ("Authorisation de la Mise sur le Marche" a French document) for each one of them.

Description: Risk of increase of the concentrations of itraconazole by the protease inhibitor
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these together. Administering large doses of itraconazole (>200 mg per day) is not recommended.

Description: Risk of decrease of the concentrations and of the effectiveness of the lamotrigine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: -Avoid beginning the treatment with ritonavir during the period of adjustment of the dosage of lamotrigine

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation
Comment: - the midazolam IV and sublingual

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the protease inhibitor, due to the enzymatic inducer effect of the St Johns wort, with risk of reduction of effectiveness, even complete loss of the effect, which can have possibly serious consequences (reduction of the antiretroviral effectiveness)
Comment: In the case of the substances being taken together by accident, do not stop the St Johns wort abruptly, but test the plasma concentrations (or the effectiveness) of the protease inhibitor before and then after the St Johns wort is stopped.

Description: Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentrations of nintedanib due to increase of its absorption by the ritonavir boosted protease inhibitor
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these substances together.

Description: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness because of decrease of the concentrations of hormonal contraceptive, due to the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type (condom or IUD), should be used during the time the substances are administered together and one cycle following.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor (even more so when the dosage of the rifabutin is large) for one thing, and risk of increase of the undesirable effects (uveitis) of the rifabutin, for another thing.
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the protease inhibitor, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.For the combination (saquinavir + ritonavir):risk of severe hepatocellular toxicity
Comment: Until additional information about the ritonavir boosted protease inhibitors is available.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the rosuvastatin due to increase of its absorption
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolisis type (decrease of the hepatic metoblism of the simvastatin).
Decrease of the concentrations of the telaprevir and of the darunavir or of the fosamprenavir, with risk of therapeutic failure.
With the atazanavir, the darunavir or the lopinavir, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its aborption
Comment: In case of administration of these together, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day. The administration with the other protease inhibitors of HIV has not been studied.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the theophylline, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the protease inhibitor and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: Choose a therapeutic alternative that is little or not at all metabolized.

Description: Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor.
Comment: Strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antimitotic.

Description: Very large reduction of the concentrations of the antifungal due to increase of its metabolism by the ritonavir, with risk of failure of the treatment
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the enzymatic inducer
Risk of decrease of the bioavailability of the tyrosine-kinase inhibitor, by reason of its pH dependent absorption
Comment: -except with the vandetanib.

Description: Risk of decrease of the bioavailability of the tyrosine-kinase inhibitor, by reason of its pH dependent absorption
Comment: -except with the imatinib and the vandetanib

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor due to decrease of its metabolism
Comment: --with the axitinib, the bosutinib, the ceritinib, the cobimetinib, the dabrafenib, the dasatinib, the nilotinib, the sunitinib

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine-kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the risk of hemorrhage

Drug 2 Class Name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE
Description: Risk of constriction of the coronary arteries or of those of the extremities (ergotism), or of rapid elevation of blood pressure.
Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when there is treatment with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the alfuzosin and of its undesirable effects
Possible increase of the sedative effect of the alprazolam
Increase of the undesirable effects of the calcium channel blockers, most often of the hypotension type, especially in older patients.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and dosage adjustment during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects
Comment: --with darifenacine

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the apixaban by the inhibitor, with increased risk of bleeding
Increase of the plasma concentrations of bedaquiline due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor.
Comment: If taking these medications together is necessary, more frequent EKG and monitoring of the transaminases are recommended.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially neurological, of the bortezomib due to decrease of its metabolism.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the bortezomib during the length of the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

Description: Increased risk of the undesirable effects of the bosentan, especially of hepatic attacks, due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring during the administration of these together

Description: Increase of the concentrations of the active metabolite of the brentuximab, with risk of neutropenia
Risk of increase of the undesirable dose dependent effects of the cabazitaxel due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the cabazitaxel during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the cobicistat or of the inhibitor of CYP3A4
Comment: To know the risks and levels of severity of each interaction,consult the specific authorization for sale to the public ("Authorisation de la Mise sur le Marche" a French document) for each one of them.

Description: Increase of the concentrations of daclatasvir by the inhibitor
Comment: The dose of daclatasvir should be decreased to 30mg once a day when it is administered with the inhibitor.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially of the vertigo or syncope type.
Risk of the undesirable effects of the disopyramide due to decrease of its metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of disopyramide.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable dose-dependent effects of the docetaxel due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the docetaxel during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of domperidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Large increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the eplerenone by the inhibitor and of its undesirable effects, especially hyperkalemia
Risk of increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to slight decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when there is also treatment with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4.

Description: Increaese of the plasma concentrations of idelalisib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase (very large for avanafil and vardenafil) of the plasma concentrations of the type 5 phospodiesterase inhibitor, with risk of hypotension (severe with vardenafil)
Severity: Contraindication - Not recommended - Precaution for use
Comment: To know the risks and levels of severity for each type 5 phospodiesterase inhibitor, consult the specific authorization for sale to the public ("Authorisation de la Mise sur le Marche" a French document) for each one of them.

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the protease inhibitor boosted by ritonavir or of the inhibitor of CYP3A4
Comment: To know the risks and levels of severity for each protease inhibitor boosted by ritonavir with the strong inhibitors of CYP3A4, consult the specific authorization for sale to the public ("Authorisation de la Mise sur le Marche" a French document) for each one of them.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor due to decrease of its metabolism
Comment: -with axitinib, bosutinib, ceritinib, cobimetinib, dabrafenib, dasatinib, nilotinib, sunitinib

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the irinotecan due to increase of the plasma concentrations of its active metabolite
Increase of the plasma concentrations of isavuconazole due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Comment: --with the ketoconazole

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor).
Large increase of the concentrations of ivacaftor, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects
Comment: Reduce the dose by a fourth, that is 150 mg every other day.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lomitapide due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of lurasidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the concentrations of maraviroc by the inhibitor.
Comment: The dose of maraviroc must be decreased to 150 mg twice a day when administered with this inhibitor.

Description: In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route, increase of the plasma concentration of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the in inhibitor, with risk of appearance of a cushings syndrome
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the olaparib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Comment: If admininstering these together cannot be avoided, limit the dose of olaparib to 150 mg twice a day.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ombitsavir + paritaprevir combination due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor.
Comment: --except with ritonavir

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the oxycodone
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of oxycodone during the length of the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones, of the panobinostat due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the panobinostat

Description: Risk increase of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Large increase of the concentrations of quetiapine, with risk of overdose
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the quinine, especially ventricular arrhythmias and neurosensory disorders (cinchonism).
Comment: -with the protease inhibitors

Description: Increase of the concentrations of ranolazine due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of riociquat due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of rivaroxaban, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of simeprevir due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the undesirable effects specific to each substrate, with frequently severe consequences
Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when there is also treatment with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosine, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially of the cardiac arrhythmia type.
Comment: with the patient who has severe renal or hepatic insufficiency

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the DM1, a componant element of the trastuzumab emtansine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the inhibitor
Bradycardia and/or disorders of atrioventricular conduction, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the verapamil by the inhibitor
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the verapamil during the treatment with the inhibitor, and after it is stopped, if the situation requires.

Description: Slight increase of the sedative effect of the zolpidem
Slight increase of the sedative effect of the zopiclone
Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: Clinical monitoring and, if the situation requires, more frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the oral anticoagulant during the administration with the SSRI and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tricyclic antidepressant with risk of convulsions and increase of the undesirable effects
Comment: Increased clinical monitoring and, if necessary, adjustment of the dosage

Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the antidepressant
Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma
Comment: Wait at least two weeks between the discontinuation of the irreversible MAOI and the start of treatment with the SSRI, and at least a week between the end of treatment with the SSRI (except fluoxetine: five weeks) and the beginning [sic].

Drug 2 Class Name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE
Description: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma
Comment: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, very strict clinical monitoring. Begin the administration with minimum recommended dosages.

Description: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat
Risk of appearance of convulsions and/or a serotonin syndrome
Risk of appearance of serotonin syndrome
Increase of the hypoglycemic reaction (inhibition of the compensation reactions which can facilitate the onset of hypoglycemic coma)
Comment: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages and medications containing alcohol.

Description: Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia: decrease or increase of the needs for insulin, due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon
Comment: Inform the patient of the risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and adjust the dosage of insulin if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog.

Drug 2 Class Name: BETA-2 MIMETICS or BETA2 ADRENERGIC AGONISTS
Description: Elevation of the glycemia by the beta-2 mimetic
Comment: Strengthen blood and urine monitoring

Description: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
Comment: Inform the patient and, especially at the start of treatment, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose.

Description: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
Comment: Inform the patient and, especially at the start of treatment, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose

Description: With large dosages (100 mg/day of chlorpromazine): elevation of the glycemia (decrease of the freeing of the insulin)
Comment: Inform the patient and strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the insulin during the treatment with the neuroleptic and after it is stopped.

Description: Diabetes inducing effect of the danazol
Comment: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, inform the patient and strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the insulin during the treatment with the danazol and after it is stopped.

Description: The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in a diabetic treated with insulin. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for insulin).
Comment: Strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose

Description: Increase of the gastrointestinal toxicity of the fluorouracil
Increase of the risk of digestive system hemorrhage
Comment: Strict clinical monitoring

Description: Probable decrease of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the irinotecan, with risk of failure of the cytotoxic treatment
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the irinotecan due to increase of the plasma concentrations of its active metabolite
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the irinotecan, with risk of failure of the cytotoxic treatment
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of isavuconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the plasma concentrations of isavuconazole due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Comment: --with the ketoconazole

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of isavuconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort

Increase of the undesirable effects, and especially of metabolic acidosis, of the acetylsalicylic acid in large doses and of the acetazolamide, due to decrease of the elimination of the acetylsalicylic acid by the acetazolamide
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
Comment: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and possible reduction of its dosage.

Description: Decrease of the lithemia with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
Comment: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

Description: Increase of the hyperammonemia, with incresed risk of encephalopathy
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Doubling of the concentrations of ambrisentan, with increase of the vasodilator effect (severe headaches )
Increase of the hepatotoxic effect of the isoniazid, with increased formation of its toxic metabolites..
Comment: In case of a scheduled intervention, it is prudent to stop the treatment with the isoniazid a week before the surgery and only restart it two weeks after.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Disorders of behavior and of coordination

Described for the prednisolone. Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the isoniazide. Mechanism proposed: increase of the hepatic metabolism of the isoniazide and decrease of that of the glucocorticoides
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of ketoconazole
Comment: Space the doses of the two anti-infectives at lease 12 hours apart. Monitor the plasma concentrations of the ketoconazole and possibly adjust its dosage.

Description: Overdose of phenytoin (decrease of its metabolism)
