Comment: Strict clinical monitoring, plasma concentration dosage of phenytoin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the isoniazid and after it is stopped.

Description: Addition of the hepatotoxic effects.
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Increase of the hepatoxicity of the isoniazid (increase of the formation of toxic metabolites of the isoniazid)
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring of this classic combination. In case of hepatitis, stop the isoniazid.

Description: Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects.
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increase of cardiac sensitization.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the itraconazole.
Comment: It is recommended that the itraconazole be administered as far distant from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours away from the dose of afatinib.

Description: Increase by nearly six times of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects
Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the gastric pH by the antisecretory
Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the intragastric pH by the proton pump inhibitor
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the itraconazole and a week after it is stopped

Description: Increase of the concentrations of aprepitant due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the intraconazole.
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin)

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome, even adrenal insufficiency
Increase of the concentrations of buprenorphine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buprenorphine during the treatment with the inhibitor and, if the situation requires, after it is stopped .

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with substantial increase of sedation
With the busulfan in large doses: doubling of the concentrations of busulfan by the itraconazole
Risk of increase of the concentrations of itraconazole by the cobicistat
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these together. The administration of large doses of itraconazole (>200mg per day) is not recommended

Description: Increase of more than double the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia with nausea, vomiting, arrhythmias
Comment: Clinical monitoring, and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia with adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the itraconazole and after it is stopped.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of elvitegravir due to decrease of its metabolism by the itraconazole
Comment: With the elvitegravir in combination with cobicistat, clinical monitoring. Limit the maximum dose of itraconazole to 200 mg/day.

Description: Risk of tinnitis and/or loss of hearing acuity: cinchonism linked to a decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the antiarrythmic by the itraconazole
Comment: Monitoring of the plasma concentrations of the antiarrythmic and possible decrease of its dosage if necessary.

Description: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immusuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: If these substances are administered together, strict testing of the renal function, blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant and possible adjustment of the dosage.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of itraconazole, with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
Risk of increase of the concentrations of itraconazole by the protease inhibitor
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these medications together. Using large doses of itraconazole (>200 mg per day) is not recommended.

Description: Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially edema, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the dihydorpyridine
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If this is possible, interrupt the torsadegenic medication. If administering these two together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand and EKG monitoring.

Description: Risk of large decrease of the plasma concentrations of itraconazole, with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the nintedanib due to increase of its absorption by the itraconazole
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these medications together.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes, as well as tinnitis and/or decrease of auditory acuity (cinchonism), due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the quinidine
Large increase of the concentrations of salmeterol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolosis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin)
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of telaprevir and of the itraconazole.
Comment: Clinical monitoring. Avoid large doses of itraconazole (>200 mg per day).

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption.
Comment: In case of co-administration with the itraconazole, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide should be limited to 10 mg per day.

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the trabectedin by the itraconazole
Comment: If administering these medications together is necessary, clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the trabectedin during the length of the treatment with the itraconazole.

Description: Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the ivabradine during the administration of these substances together and after the inducer is stopped.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes. In addition, increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine due to decrease of its metabolism by the azithromycin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG during the administration of these substances together.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem), that add to the bradycardia inducing effects of these molecules
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor).
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the josamycin).
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its intestinal metabolism by the grapefruit).
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the ivabradine during the administration of the two substances together and after the rifampicin is stopped..

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil), that add to the bradycardia inducing effects of these molecules
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and. if needed, plasma dosage and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

Description: Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia
Comment: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration with the macrolide and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the disopyramide: severe hypoglyclemia, lengthening of the QT interval, and serious ventricular arrhythmias, especially of the torsades de pointes type
Comment: Regular clinical, biological and electrocardiographic testing.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If this is possible, interrupt the macrolide. If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, testing before hand of the QT and EKG monitoring.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the josamycin).
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentrations of sildenafil, with risk of hypotension
Comment: Start the treatment with sildenafil at the minimun dose when it is administered with josamycin.

Description: Increase of the blood concentrations of tacrolimus and of the creatinemia, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the tacrolimus by the josamycin
Risk of increase of the theophyllinemia, particularly with children
Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the ketoconazole.
Comment: It is recommended that the ketoconazole be administered as far from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 or 12 hours away from doses of the afatinib

Description: Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the gastric pH by the antisecretory
Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the gastric pH by the anitsecretory
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin)

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome, even adrenal insufficiency
Increase of the concentrations of buprenorphine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buprenorphine during the treatment with the inhibitor and, if the situation requires, after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of more than double of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias with predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of elvitegravir due to decrease of its metabolism by the ketoconazole
Comment: With the elvitegravir combined with cobicistat, clinical monitoring. Limit the maximum dose of ketoconazole to 200 mg/day.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicine
Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism.
Comment: If these substances are administered together, strict monitoring of the renal function, blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, and possible adjustment of the dosage.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of ketoconazole
Comment: Space the doses of the two anti-infectives at lease 12 hours apart. Monitor plasma concentrations of the ketoconazole and possibly adjust its dosage.

Description: Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially edema, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the dihydropyridine
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If this is possible, interrupt the medication tending to cause torsades de pointes. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand, and EKG monitoring.

Description: Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Increase of the plasma concentrations of nevirapine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole for one thing, and decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ketoconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the nevirapine, for another thing
Increase of the plasma concentrations of nintedanib due to increase of its absorption by the ketoconazole
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these substances together.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the two anti-infectives (enzymatic induction by the rifampicin and decrease of the intestinal absorption by the azole antifungal)
Large increase of the concentrations of salmeterol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolisis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering substance)
Comment: Use a statin not affected by this type of interaction.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
Comment: In case of co-administration with the ketoconazole, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day.

Description: Increase of the concentrations of vanlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cladribine by the lamivudine
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
Risk of increase of the neurological effects (vertigo, ataxia, diplopia) of the carbamazepine when the lamotrigine is introduced
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

Description: Risk of decrease of the concentrations and of the effectiveness of the lamotrigine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: -avoid starting an oral contraceptive during the period of adjustment of the dosage of the lamotrigine.

Description: Risk of decrease of the concentrations and of the effectiveness of the lamotrigine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: -Avoid beginning the treatment with ritonavir during the period of adjustment of the dosage of the lamotrigine

Description: Decrease of the concentrations of the lamotrigine with risk of lower effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the oxcarbazepine
Comment: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations, with adjustment of the dosage of the lamotrigine if needed.

Description: Increased risk of serious cutaneous reactions (Lyell's syndrome). In addition, increase of the plasma concentrations of lamotrigine (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the sodium valproate)
Comment: If this combination of medications is judged necessary, strict clinical monitoring.

Description: Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus
Comment: Blood concentration dosage of the tacrolimus, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of these medications together and after it is stopped.

Description: Described for warfarin and acenocoumarol. Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the aminoglutethimide.
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the Vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with aminoglutethimide and two weeks after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the effectiveness of the dexamethasone, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Adjustment of the dosage of the dexamethasone.

Description: Only when ledipasvir is combined with sofosbuvir, appearance of bradycardia, possibly abruptly, which can have fatal consequences.
Comment: If administering these together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring of patients is recommended, in particular during the first weeks of treatment with the ledipasvir/sofosbuvir combination (clinical monitoring and EKG).

Description: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant enzymatic inducer.
Decrease of the concentrations of the ledipasvir when the proton pump inhibitor is administered before the ledipasvir
Comment: It is recommended that the proton pump inhibitor and the ledipasvir be administered simultaneously

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the statin and of its undesirable effects of the rhabdomyolysis type
Comment: --with the rosuvastatin

Description: Risk of large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ripampicin
When administered with a protease inhibitor, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir by the ledipasvir
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring, especially of the renal function

Description: Increased risk of onset of rhabdomyolysis
Comment: Strengthen clinical and biological monitoring, especially during the first weeks of treatment.

Description: Moderate increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant and more notable increase of the concentrations of the lercanidipine
Comment: Separate the time when the two medications are taken. Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, and adjustment if necessary of its dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped

Description: Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially edema, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the dihydorpyridine
Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially edema, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the dihydropyridine
Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially of edema, due to decrease of the intestinal metabolism of the dihydropyridine
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the levocarnitine and a week after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of aggravation of the Parkinsonian syndrome or of undesirable central effects (visual hallucinations, confusion, headaches)
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the levodopa
Comment: Take the iron salts at a different time from the levodopa (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

Description: Increase of the risk of orthostatic hypotension
Increase of the effects of the levodopa but equally of its undesirable effects. Increase of the antihypertensive effect of the methyldopa
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possibly decrease of the doses of levodopa.

Description: Reciprocal antagonism between the levodopa and the neuroleptic
Comment: Use an antiemitic without extrapyramidal effects.

Description: Reciprocal antagonism between the levodopa and the neuroleptics
Comment: With a parkinsons patient, use the minimum effective dosees of each of the two medications.

Description: Inhibition of the effects of the levodopa
When administered with the carbidopa: inhibition of the absorption of the carbidopa with decrease of the plasma concentrations of the levodopa
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the levodopa.

Description: Reciprocal antagonism between the levodopa and the tetrabenazine

Drug 2 Class Name: SUBSTANCES THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES
Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG during the administrations of these substances together.

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine, with possibility of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the amiodarone
Comment: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the lidocaine during the treatment with amiodarone and after it is stopped.

Description: With the lidocaine administered by IV route: increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine with possibility of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (decrease of the hepatic clearance of the lidocaine)
Comment: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine during the administration of the substances together and after the beta-blocking agent is stopped. Adjustment if needed of the dosage of the lidocaine

Description: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure

With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine with risk of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the lidocaine)
Comment: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly monitoring of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the lidocaine during the treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine with possibilities of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (decrease of the hepatic clearance of the lidocaine)
Comment: Clinical monitoring, EKG and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine during and after the administration of the two substances together. Adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the lidocaine.

Description: Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent
Comment: Monitor the degree of curarisation at the end of anesthesia.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the linezolide by the clarithromycin, due to increase of its absorption
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the linezolide due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible increase of the dosage of the linezolide during the treatment with the rifampicin.

Description: Decrease of the lithemia with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
Comment: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

Drug 2 Class Name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)
Description: Increase of the lithemia that can attain toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium).
Comment: If the use of the angiotensin II antagonist is indispensable, strict monitoring of the lithemia and adjustment of the dosage

Description: Increase of the lithemia that can reach toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium)
Comment: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, monitor the lithemia closely and adjust the dosage of the lithium during the administration of the substances together and after the NSAI is stopped.

Description: In case of sudden discontinuation of consumption of coffee or of medications containing caffeine, risk of increase of the lithemia
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the lithium due to increase of its renal elimination by the calcitonin
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: Risk of neurotoxicity manifesting as disorders of the cerebellum, confusion, drowsiness, ataxia. These disorders are reversible when the treatment with lithium is stopped
Increase of the lithemia with signs of overdose of lithium as with a low sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
Comment: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring of the lithemia and adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

Drug 2 Class Name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)
Description: Increase of the lithemia with signs of overdose of lithium, as with a low sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
Comment: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

Description: Increase of the lithemia with signs of overdose of lithium, as with a low sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
Comment: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring of the lithemia and adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

Description: Decrease of the lithemia with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
Comment: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

Description: Increase of the lithemia which can reach toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium)
Comment: If the use of an ACE inhibitor is indispensable, strict monitoring of the lithemia and adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

Description: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

Description: Decrease of the lithemia with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
Comment: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

Description: Increase of the lithemia which can attain toxic values, with signs of overdose of lithium
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

Description: Increase of the lithemia which can attain toxic values with signs of overdose of lithium.
Comment: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

Description: Risk of appearance of neuropsychic signs evocative of a neuroleptic malignant syndrome or of lithium poisoning
Comment: Regular clinical amd biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the lithium due to increase of its renal elimination by the sodium salts
Comment: Avoid excessive sodium and take account of the presence of sodium in certain medications such as antacids.

Description: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the lithium due to increase of its renal elimination by the sodium salts.
Comment: Avoid excessive sodium and take account of the presence of sodium in certain medications such as antacids.

Description: Decrease of the lithemia with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
Comment: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

Description: For doses of topiramate >= 200 mg/day: increase of the lithemia that can reach toxic values, with signs of overdose of lithium.
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring. Adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

Description: Increased risk of nephrotoxicity and ototoxicity (the ototoxicity is cumulative in cases of successive administrations of the aminoglycosides)
Comment: -in case of simultaneous administration

Description: With the amphotericin B administered intravenously:increased risk of nephrotoxicity
Risk of increase of the renal toxicity of the aminoside.
Risk of increase of the effects of the botulinum toxin with the aminoglycosides (due to extrapolation from the effects observed during the course of the botulism)
Comment: Use another antibiotic

Description: Increase of the nephrotoxicity of the aminoglycosides by the cefalotin is under discussion
Comment: Monitoring of renal function

Description: Larger increase of the creatinemia than with ciclosporin alone, with increase of the nephrotoxic risk
Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent.
Comment: Monitor the degree of curarization at the end of anesthesia

Description: Increase of the nephrotoxic and ototoxic risks of the aminoglycoside (functional renal insufficiency linked to the dehydration caused by the diuretic)
Comment: The two medications may be taken together when there is monitoring of the state of hydration, of the renal and cochleovestibulary functions, and, possibly, of the plasma concentrations of the aminoglycoside.

Description: Addition of the nephrotoxic and/or ototoxic effects, especially in the case of pre-existing renal insufficiency
Addition of the nephrotoxic effects
Comment: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring with an indisputable bacteriological justification

Description: Greater increase of the creatinemia than with tacrolimus alone (synergy of the nephrotoxic effects of the two substances)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lomitapide due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the lomitapide
With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increased bone marrow toxicity (inhibition of the metabolism of the lomustine)
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the losartan, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the fluconazole
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If this is possible, interrupt the substance tending to cause torsades de pointes. If administering the two together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT before hand and EKG monitoring.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If this is possible, interrupt the substance tending to cause torsades de pointes. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand and EKG monitoring.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If this is possible, interrupt the substance tending to cause torsades de pointes. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand and EKG monitoring.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If this is possible, interrupt the substance tending to cause torsades de pointes. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand and EKG monitoring.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the lurasidone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the plasma concentrations of lurasidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the lurasidone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lurasidone due to decrease of its metabolism by the grapefruit
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of macitentan due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of macitentan due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort

Drug 2 Class Name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE
Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dopaminergic with possible increase of its activity or appearance of signs of overdose.
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the macrolide and after it is stopped

Description: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, with potentially fatal consequences
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic elimination of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremeties (decrease of the hepatic elimination of the ergotamine).
Decrease of the lithemia with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
Comment: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

Description: Significant decrease of the concentrations of amprenavir that could lead to a loss of the virological response
In the absence of the administration at the same time with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4, decrease of the concentrations of maraviroc by the inducer
Comment: The dose of maraviroc must be increased to 600 mg twice a day in this situation.

Description: Increase of the concentrations of maraviroc by the inhibitor
Comment: The dose of maraviroc must be reduced to 150 mg twice a day if it is taken with this inhibitor.

Description: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of maraviroc that could lead to a loss of the virological response

Drug 1 Class Name: MEDICATIONS AT THE ORIGIN OF A SEROTONIN SYNDROME
Drug 2 Class Name: OTHER MEDICATIONS AT THE ORIGIN OF A SEROTONIN SYNDROME
Description: Risk of appearance or of increased severity of a serotonin syndrome in case of administering any of these medications with any of the others.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib by increase of its absorption by the amiodarone.
Comment: It is recommended that the amiodarone be administered as far as possible from the afatinib, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

Description: Increase of the effect of the Vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the amiodarone and a week after it is stopped.

Drug 2 Class Name: BETA BLOCKING AGENTS (EXCEPT ESMOLOL AND SOTALOL)
Description: Disorders of autoregulation and conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG

Description: Disorders of autoregulation and of cardiac conduction with risk of excessive bradycardia
Comment: Regular clinical monitoring and EKG

Description: Increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of nephrotoxic effects
Comment: Blood concentration dosages of ciclosporin, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage of the ciclosporin during the treatment with the amiodarone.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the amiodarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the cobicistat
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with greater risk of bleeding
Comment: For post surgical indications:

Description: Only with the bitherapy daclatasvir/sofosbuvi:Appearance of bradycardia, possibly abrupt, that can have fatal consequences.
Comment: If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, clinical monitoring and strict EKG, in particular during the first weeks of treatment with the bitherapy

Description: Depression of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia) and difficulties with atrioventricular conduction. Furthermore, increase of the blood concentrations of digoxin due to decrease of the clearance of the digoxin.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG and, if there is need for it, testing of the digoxinemia and adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin.

Description: For diltiazem by injection: risk of bradycardia and of atrioventricular blockFor diltiazem by mouth: risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially in older persons.
Comment: -with diltiazem administered by IV

Description: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation, and electrical conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Risk of lengthening of the QT interval
Comment: Clinical monitoring, particularly with large doses of fluconazole (800mg/d)

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of ibrutinib by decease of its hepatic metabolism by the amiodarone
Comment: Strict clinical monitoring and reduction of the dose of ibrutinib to 140 mg per day during the time these two medications are administered together.

Description: Only with the ledipasvir/sofosbuvir bitherapy, appearance of bradycardia, possibly abrupt, that can have fatal consequences
Comment: If the use of these medications together cannot be avoided, close monitoring of patients is recommended, in particular during the first weeks of treatment with the bitherapy (clinical monitoring and EKG).

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine, with possibility of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the amiodarone
Comment: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the lidocaine during the treatment with amiodarone and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of nintedanib due to increase of its absorption by the amiodarone.
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these medications together.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of olaparib by the amiodarone
Comment: If administering these together cannot be avoided, limit the dose of olaparib to 200 mg twice a day with the amiodarone.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the amiodarone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the therapy with ombitasvir+paritaprevir
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the amiodarone and of its active metabolite
Comment: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, EKG

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenytoin with signs of overdose, in particular neurological ones (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin)
Comment: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin and possible adjustment of its dosage

Description: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin).
Comment: Do not exceed the dosage of 20mg/day of simvastatin or use another statin not affected by this type of interaction

Description: Only when administered with the combinations daclatasvir/sofosbuvir or ledispasvir/sofosbuvir:Possibly abrupt appearance of bradycardia, which can have fatal consequences.
Comment: If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and EKG, in particular during the first weeks of treatment with the combinations with sofosbuvir.

Description: Increase of the blood concentrations of tacrolimus due to inhibition of its metabolism by the amiodarone.
Comment: Blood concentration dosage of tacrolimus, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage of tacrolimus during the administration of it and the amiodarone together and when the amiodarone is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosin due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosin during the treatment with the enzymatic inhibitor and after it is stopped, if the situation requires.

Description: Disorders of autoregulation and of cardiac conduction with risk of excessive bradycardia
For verapamil by injection: -risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block. For verapamil by mouth:-risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients
Comment: -verapamil administered via IV

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes, due to possible decrease of the metabolism of the amiodarone
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the amiodarone.

Drug 1 Class Name: MEDICATIONS AT THE ORIGIN OF ORTHOSTATIC HYPOTENSION
Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially of the vertigo and fainting type
Comment: -with the type 5 phospohdisterase inhibitors

Drug 1 Class Name: MEDICATIONS AT HE ORIGIN OF ORTHOSTATIC HYPOTENSION
Description: Risk of increase of hypotension, especially orthostatic

Drug 1 Class Name: MEDICATIONS AT RISK WHEN WITHDRAWING FROM TOBACCO
Description: Risk of overdose when replacing tobacco by the replacement therapy
Increase of the risk of hypotension, especially orthostatic

Drug 2 Class Name: MEDICATIONS AT THE ORIGIN OF ORTHOSTATIC HYPOTENSION
Description: Risk of increase of hypotension, especially orthostatic

Drug 1 Class Name: MEDICATIONS THAT LOWER THE EPILEPTIC THRESHOLD
Drug 2 Class Name: OTHER MEDICATIONS THAT LOWER THE EPILEPTIC THRESHOLD
Description: Accrued risk of convulsions
Addition of the undesirable atropinic effects such as urinary retention, constipation, dry mouth
Risk of addition of the effects of the methomoglobinizing agents.
Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increased cardiac sensitization.
Comment: Limit the amount of adrenaline, for example: less than 0.1 mg of adrenaline in 10 minutes or 0.3 mg in an hour for an adult.

Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: Clinical monitoring and, if the situation requires, more frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the oral anticoagulant during the administration of these medications together and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma.
Comment: Wait two weeks between stopping the MAOI and the start of the other treatment, and at least a week between the end of that treatment and the start of the MAOI.

Drug 2 Class Name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE
Description: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, confusion, even coma
Comment: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, very strict clinical monitoring. Begin the administration of the substances together with minimum recommended dosages.

Description: Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat

Drug 2 Class Name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

Risk of increase of the nephrotoxicity
Increase of the ototoxicity
Increase by the alcohol of the sedative effect of these substances. The alteration of alertness can make driving vehicles or using machines dangerous
Comment: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages or medications containing alcohol.

Comment: --with sodium oxybate

Description: For the quinine administered by IV route: increased risk of onset of epileptic crises due to addition of the convulsion producing effects
Comment: Wait at least 12 hours between the end of the administration via IV of the quinine and the beginning of the administration of the mefloquine.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor

Description: Lactic acidosis linked to elevated concentrations of metformin in relation to the functional renal insufficiency induced by the radiological exam.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of methadone with overdose and increased risk of lengthening of the QT interval and of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Comment: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

Description: Increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate due to inhibition of its renal tubular secretion by the ciprofloxacin

Risk of addition of the ototoxic and/or nephrotoxic effects
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the amiodarone and of its active metabolite

Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage

Comment: Take the orlistat at a different time from the ciclosporin (at least three hours apart). Reinforce testing of the blood dosages of the ciclosporin, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two medications together, and at the time of a possible increase of the dosage of the orlistat.

Description: Risk of disequilibrium of the thyroid replacement therapy in cases where there is treatment with orlistat
Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat
Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat
Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat
Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat

Increase of the toxicity of the fluorouracil due to decrease of its clearance

Description: Decrease of the concentrations of the lamotrigine with risk of lower effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the oxcarbazepine

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the oxycodone due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Comment: Possible adjustment of the dosage of oxycodone.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the oxycodone
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of oxycodone during the length of the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the oxycodone due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort
Comment: Possible adjustment of the dosage of the oxycodone

Description: Increase of the concentrations of the paclitaxel by the clopidogrel, with risk of increase of undesirable effects.
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the aliskiren when grapefruit is consumed
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the cholesterol lowering medication, with risk of appearance of undesirable effects, especially muscular ones.

Increase of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib by decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the grapefruit

Large increase of the plasma concentrations of the lipid lowering drug, with risk of appearance of undesirable effects, especially muscular ones
Doubling of the plasma concentrations of the antiagregant, with risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially hemorrhagic

Increase of the plasma concentrations of verapamil, with risk of undesirable effects

Description: Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose (decrease of the metabolism of the theophylline)

Description: Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia:decrease or increase of the needs for repaglinde due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon .

Comment: Strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and adjust the dosage of the sulfonamide if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog.

Description: Increased risk of onset of pancreatitis due to addition of undesirable effects

Description: Risk of severe hypocalcemia

Increase of the risk of pulmonary toxicity which could be fatal

Antagonist effect of the phenobarbital
Progressive decrease of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and of its active metabolite without apparent modification of its anticonvulsive effectiveness
Comment: Use prudence with respect to the interpretation of the plasma concentrations.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the felbamate and increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenobarbital, with risk of overdose.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenobarbital with adjustment of the dosage if needed.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the phenobarbital, due to increase of its metabolism of which the folates represent one of the cofactors
Comment: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations, and adjustment, if there is reason for it, of the dosage of the phenobarbital during the folic supplementation and after it is stopped.

Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the metoprolol with reduction of its clinical effects (increase of its hepatic metabolism)

When the phenobarbital or the primidone is stopped, possibility of toxic effects of the phenytoin.--it can happen that the concentrations of phenytoin are increased (inhibition of the metabolism due to competition)
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propranolol with reduction of its clinical effects (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
Increase of the hyperammonemia with increased risk of encephalopathy

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenytoin with signs of overdose, in particular neurological ones (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin)

Description: Reciprocal reduction of the plasma concentrations (increase of the metabolism without apparent modification of the anticonvulsive effectiveness)

Comment: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring, plasma concentration dosages of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with risk of overdose, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the felbamate
Comment: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin, and if needed, adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the felbamate.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin that can reach toxic values. Mechanism proposed: inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin
Comment: Strict clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of the metabolism of the phenytoin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. If needed, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with the fluoxetine and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin due to increase of its metabolism of which the folates represent one of the cofactors
Comment: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the phenytoin during the folic supplementation and after it is stopped.
