Description: Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the gastric pH by the H2 receptor antagonist
Comment: --only with the oral suspension form of posaconazole

Description: Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal, due to increase of the gastric pH by the inhibitor
Comment: --only for the oral suspension form of posaconazole

Description: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia with nausea, vomiting, arrhythmias.
Comment: Clinical monitoring, and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia, with adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the posaconazole and after it is stopped.

Description: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: If these medications are administered together, strict testing of renal function, blood concentration dosages of the immunosuppressant, and possible adjustment of the dosage.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis), due to increase of its concentrations and of those of its active metabolite
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the medications together.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the two anti-infectives (enzymatic induction by the rifampicin and decrease of the intestinal absorption by the azole antifungal)
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor)
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the posaconazole

Drug 2 Class Name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)
Description: Hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects).
Comment: Avoid administering these substances together unless there is pre-existing hypokalemia.

Description: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
Comment: Avoid the administration of these two substances together unless there is pre-existing hypokalemia.

Drug 2 Class Name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)
Description: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially with patients having renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkaliemia producing effects)
Comment: -aside from hypokalemia or in case of parenteral use of the potassium salts

Description: Hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
Comment: Unless there is hypokalemia.

Description: Essentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia producing effects)
Comment: Avoid administering these substances together unless there is a preexisting hypokalemia.

Description: Erythema, blisters, even necrosis of skin and mucosa (formation of a caustic complex in the case of concomitant use of mercurials and iodine antiseptics). The interaction depends on the stability of the organo-mercurial at the cutaneous level and on individual sensitivity.
Increase of the plasma concentration of the pravastatin by the clarithromycin
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring during the treatment with the antibiotic

Description: With the erythromycin administered by oral route: increase of the plasma concentration of the pravastatin by the erythromycin
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring during the treatment with the antibiotic.

Description: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the praziquantel, with risk of failure of the treatment due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the praziquantel, with risk of failure of the treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the praziquantel by the dexamethasone.
Comment: Separate the administration of the two medications by at least a week.

Description: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the praziquantal, with risk of failure of the treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the praziquantel by the rifampicin
Increase of the effects of the prednisolone: characteristic Cushings appearance, reduction of tolerance of carbohydrates (decrease of the clearance of the prednisolone)
Risk of rupture of the condom when used with lubricants containing mineral oils (paraffin oil, silicone oil, etc...)
Comment: Use a hydrosoluble lubricant (glycerin, polyacrylamide...).

Description: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increased cardiac sensitization
Comment: Limit the amount of adrenaline, for example: less then 0.1 mg of adrenaline in 10 minutes or 0.3 mg per hour for an adult

Description: Reduction of the compensatory cardiovascular reactions by the beta blocking agents. The beta-andrenergic inhibition can be elevated by the beta-mimetics during surgery.
Comment: As a general rule, do not stop the treatment with the beta-blocking agent and, in any event, avoid stopping it abruptly. Inform the anesthesiologist of this treatment.

Description: Reduction of the compensatory cardiovascular reactions by the beta blocking agents. The beta-adrenergic inhibition can be elevated during the surgery by the beta-stimulants.
Comment: As a general rule, do not stop the treatment with the beta blocking agent and, in any case, avoid stopping it abruptly. Inform the anesthesiologist of this treatment.

Description: Increase of the hepatotoxic effect of the isoniazid, with increased formation of its toxic metabolites..
Comment: In case of a scheduled intervention, it is prudent to stop the treatment with the isoniazid a week before the surgery and only restart it two weeks after.

Description: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increase of cardiac sensitization

Drug 2 Class Name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)
Description: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increase of cardiac sensitization
Perioperative hypertension
Comment: In the case of scheduled surgery, it is preferable to stop the treatment several days before surgery.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the afatinib due to increase of its metabolism by the primidone
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these together and 1 to 2 weeks after they are stopped.

Description: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the pristinamycin and after it is stopped

Description: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine with potentially fatal consequences
Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of its dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of overdose due to increase of the plasma concentrations of diprophylline (inhibition of its renal tubular secretion)
Comment: Reduce the dosage of diprophylline during the treatment with the probenicid

Description: Increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate: inhibition of the renal tubular secretion of the methotrexate by the probenecid
Increase of the hypersensitivity reactions (hypereosinophilia, rash), due to increase of the metabolism of the procarbazine by the inducer
Increase of the risk of reaction to the contrast media in cases of previous treatment with interleukin2: skin rash or more rarely low blood pressure, oliguria or even renal failure
In case of dehydration caused by the diuretics, increased risk of acute functional renal insufficiency, in particular when large doses of the contrast media are used
Comment: Rehydrate before administration of the iodinated product

Description: Lactic acidosis linked to elevated concentrations of metformin in relation to functional renal insufficiency induced by the radiological exam.
Comment: The treatment with metformin should be suspended at the time of the radiological exam and only started again 2 days later.

Description: (Except IUD), decrease of the concentrations of progestin, with risk of lower contraceptive effectiveness
Comment: Use another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type, during the length of time that these are administered together and one cycle after.

Description: Aside from the combination ethinylestradiol (0.035mg)/norethisterone (1 mg), risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the boceprevir
Comment: Use an additional or alternative, reliable contraceptive method during the administration of these medications together.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Use an additional or alternative, reliable contraceptive method during the administration of these medications together and a cycle after.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Use an additional or alternative, reliable contraceptive method during the administration of these medications together and a cycle after.

Description: Decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Comment: Another reliable contraceptive method, in particular a barrier type, should be used during the administration of these medications together and a cycle after.

Description: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness because of decrease of the concentrations of hormonal contraceptive, due to the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
Comment: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type (condom or IUD), should be used during the time the substances are administered together and one cycle following.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the hormonal contraceptive, by reason of the enzymatic inducer effect of the St Johns wort, with risk of reduction of effectiveness, even complete loss of the effect, which can have possibly serious consequences (pregnancy)
For doses of perampanel >=12 mg/day: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness
Comment: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type, should be used.

Description: Risk of antagonism of the effects of the progestin contraceptive
Comment: Do not restart the progestin contraceptive treatment fewer than 12 days after stopping the ulipristal.

Drug 1 Class Name: NON-CONTRACEPTIVE PROGESTOGENS, COMBINED WITH AN ESTROGEN OR NOT
Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the progestogen
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration of the bosentan and after it is stopped

Drug 1 Class Name: NON-CONTRACEPTIVE PROGESTOGENS, COMBINED WITH AN ESTROGEN OR NOT
Description: Decrease of the effectiveness of the progestogen
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration of the inducer and after it is stopped.

Drug 1 Class Name: NON-CONTRACEPTIVE PROGESTOGENS, COMBINED WITH AN ESTROGEN OR NOT
Description: Risk of antagonism of the effects of the progestogen
Comment: In a uterine fibroid indication, do no restart a progestogen treatment fewer than 12 days after the ulipristal is ended.

Description: Risk of increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the proguanil and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of clinically low thyroid with patients having thyroid replacement therapy
Comment: Monitoring of the serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormone during the treatment with the antimalarial and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the abiraterone
Comment: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the abiraterone

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propafenone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the administration of it and the inducer together and after the inducer is stopped.

Description: Increase of the anticoagulant effect and of the risk of hemorrhage. Mechanism proposed: inhibition of the metabolism of the vitamin K antagonist
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the propafenone and after it is stopped.

Description: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation, and conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
Comment: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the bupropion.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of propafenone with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
Comment: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with cinacalcet.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of propafenone, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the darifenacin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with darifenacin.

Description: Risk of increase of the digoxinemia, especially with older patients
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with propafenone and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of propafenone with risk of overdosage due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the duloxetine
Comment: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the duloxetine and after it is stopped.

Description: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation and conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propafenone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the time the substances are administered together and after the St Johns wort is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the propafenone by decrease of its metabolism by the mirabegron
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the propafenone during the administration of these substances together.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propafanone, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the administration of the substances together and after the rifampicin is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine
Comment: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the terbinafine.

Description: Risk of increase of the theophyllinemia due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the propafenone.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia.

Description: Ergotism: some cases of arterial spasm with ischemia of the extremities have been observed (addition of vascular effects)
Comment: Reinforce clinical monitoring, in particular during the first weeks of the administration of these medications together.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of propranolol due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of the activity and of the undesirable effects, for example: significant bradycardia
Comment: Increased clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propranolol during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propranolol with reduction of its clinical effects (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the beta-blocking agent (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
Antabuse effect (heat, redness, vomiting, tachycardia)
Comment: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages and medications containing alcohol. Take into account the complete elimination of the medications by referring to their half-life before re-starting alcoholic beverages or medications containing alcohol.

Description: Addition of the hepatotoxic effects.
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Megaloblastic anemia, more particularly with large doses of the two products (deficit of folic acid due to the combination of two 2-4 diaminopyrimidines)
Comment: Regular CBC and addition of a treatment with folic acid (regular IM injections).

Description: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of quetiapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer, with risk of ineffectiveness.
Large increase of the concentrations of quetiapine, with risk of overdose
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of quetiapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer, with risk of ineffectiveness
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the quetiapine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ombitasvir+paritaprevir combination
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of quetiapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer, with risk of ineffectiveness.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the quinidine and risk of overdose (decrease of the renal excretion of the quinidine by alkalinizing of the urine).
Comment: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the quinidinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage during the alkalinizing treatment and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects.
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the quinidine due to decrease of its metabolism by the cobicistat
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Comment: In a post surgical indication: clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the dabigatran to 150 mg/day in one dose.

Description: Increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the renal clearance of the digoxin. In addition, disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia and disorders of atrioventricular conduction)
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG. In the case of an unexpected result, test the digoxinemia and adjust the dosage.

Description: Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the quinidine
Comment: Start the treatment with quinidine at minimum recommended dosages, and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes, as well as tinnitis and/or decrease of auditory acuity (cinchonism), due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the quinidine
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the quidinine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ombitasvir+paritaprevir combination
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the quinidine
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the torsade inducing medication)
Comment: Wait 24 hours between stopping the triclabendazole and the dose of the torsade inducing medication, and the reverse.

Description: Risk of large increase of the hemodynamic effects of the verapamil, with severe hypotension and bradycardia
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the vortioxetine due to large decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the treatment with the quinidine and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of loss of the effectiveness of the quinine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the quinine during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

Description: Moderate increase of the digoxinemia
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG, if needed, with possible adjustment of the doses of digoxin.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the quinine, especially ventricular arrhythmias and neurosensory difficulties (cinchonism)
Comment: -with the protease inhibitors

Description: For the quinine administered by IV route: increased risk of onset of epileptic crises due to addition of the convulsion producing effects
Comment: Wait at least 12 hours between the end of the administration via IV of the quinine and the beginning of the administration of the mefloquine.

Description: Risk of loss of the effectiveness of the quinine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the angioedema type.
Comment: -in case of previous angioedema while taking ACE inhibitors

Description: Decrease of the concentrations of the raltegravir by the rifampicin
Comment: If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, doubling the dose of raltegravir can be considered

Description: Risk of large decrease of the concentrations of ranolazine
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type due to inhibition of the metabolism of the atorvastatin by the ranolazine
Comment: Use weaker doses of the cholesterol lowering agent or another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

Description: Increase of the digoxinemia
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring, and possibly EKG. Adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin if needed.

Description: Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its metabolism by the ranolazine
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the immunosuppressant.

Description: Increase of the concentrations of ranolazine due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
Very large decrease of the concentrations of ranolazine.
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type due to inhibition of the metabolism of the simvastatin by the ranolazine
Comment: Do not exceed the dosage of 20 mg/day of simvastatin or use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort
Increase of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the grapefruit
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the calcium channel blocker due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: with the nimodipine

Description: Increase of the undesirable effects of the calcium channel blockers, of the orthostatic hypotension sort, especially with older patients
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the calcium channel blocker during the treatment with idelalisib and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the undesirable effects of the calcium channel blockers, most often of the hypotension type, especially in older patients.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and dosage adjustment during the treatment with the enzymatic inhibitor and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the calcium channel blocker due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: with the nimodipine

Description: Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia:decrease or increase of the need for repaglinde due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon .
Comment: Strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and adjust the dosage of the repaglinide if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog

Description: The concentrations of repaglinide more than doubled due to increase of its absorption
Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the plasma concentrations of the repaglinide
Comment: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering agent during the treatment with the clarithromycin.

Description: Increase of the concentrations of repaglinide by the clopidogrel, with risk of increase of undesirable effects
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the deferasirox
Comment: If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, strict clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Risk of severe hypoglycemia, even coma, due to substantial increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide by the gemfibrozil
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the trimethoprim
Comment: If the administration of these medications together cannot be avoided, strict clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Psychomotor agitation, convulsions, hypertension
Inhibition of the effects of the levodopa
Taking chelating resins can decrease the intestinal absorption and, potentially, the effectiveness of other medications taken simultaneously
Comment: As a general rule, the doses of the resin should be taken at a different time from that of other medications, at an interval of more than 2 hours apart, if possible

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the thyroid hormones
Comment: Take the thyroid hormones at a different time from the resin (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

Description: Risk of symptoms evocative of hypervitaminosis A
Risk of intracranial hypertension
Risk of symptoms evocative of hypervitaminosis A
Increased risk of serious undesirable effects, due to inhibition of the metabolism of the immunomodulator by the ribavirin
Risk of increase of the mitochrondrial toxicity of the didanosine due to increase of its active metabolite
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral, due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral, due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: Moderate decrease of the plasma concentrations of atovaquone by the enzymatic inducer

Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis) due to increase of its concentrations and of those of its active metabolite by the clarithromycin. In addition, increase of the metabolism of the clarithromycin by the rifabutin, with increase of the concentrations of its active metabolite
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two medications together.

Description: Very large increase of the metabolite of the rifabutin, with risk of increase of its toxicity (uveitis, neutropenia). Furthermore, possible decrease of the concentrations of cobicistat
Comment: Adjustment of the dosage of the rifabutin (in principle, reduction of the doses by half).

Description: Decrease by about half of the concentrations of rifabutin, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the efavirenz
Comment: Adjustment of the dosage of the rifabutin during the treatment with efavirenz.

Description: Decrease of the minimal concentrations of elvitegravir
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis), due to increase of its concentrations and of those of its active metabolite
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the treatment with the two medications together.

Description: Described for phenytoin, rifampicin, and carbamazepine. Risk of clinical hypothyroidism in patients with low thyroid, due to increase of the metabolism of the T3 and T4
Comment: Monitoring of serum concentrations of T3 and of T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormones during the treatment with rifabutin and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor (even more so when the dosage of the rifabutin is large) for one thing, and risk of increase of the undesirable effects (uveitis) of the rifabutin for another.
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis), due to increase of its concentrations and of those of its active metabolite
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the medications together.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifabutin for one thing; and risk of increase of the undesirable effects (uveitis) of the rifabutin for another
Comment: If the administration of these substances together is judged necessary, clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole (generally doubled) during the treatment with the rifabutin.

Description: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the abiraterone, with risk of lower effectiveness
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the afatinib due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these medications together and 1 to 2 weeks after they are stopped.

Description: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the inducer, with risk of reduction of its effectiveness
Comment: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzymatic inducer and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the calcium channel blocker due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: --with nimodipine

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the antiarrythmic (increase of its hepatic metabolism).
Comment: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly monitoring of the plasma concentration of the antiarrythmic. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the antiarrythmic during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped (risk of overdose of the antiarrythmic)

Description: Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the rifampicin and a week after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the apixaban by the rifampicin, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect.
Very large decrease of the concentrations of aprepitant
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of atorvastastatin, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of atorvaquone by the enzymatic inducer
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of boceprevir
Comment: If administering these together cannot be avoided, regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of treatment with the two medications together.

Description: Risk of decrease, large for the rifampicin, of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the buspirone during the treatment with rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the carbamazepine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations and adjustment of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the carvedilol, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Regular clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the carvedilol during the treatment with the rifampicin. When the rifampicin is stopped, risk of large increase of the plasma concentrations of carvedilol imposing a reduction of the dosage and strict clinical monitoring.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and risk of lower effectiveness of the clarithromycin, especially with HIV patients, due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Risk of ineffectiveness of the antipsychotic treatment (decrease of the plasma concentrations of clozapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism)
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible increase of the dosage of the clozapine during the treatment with the rifampicin.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cobicistat due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of deferasirox
Comment: Monitor the ferritinemia during and after the treatment with the enzymatic inducer. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of deferasirox.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of delamanid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Large decrease of the concentrations of dronedarone due to increase of its metabolism, without significant modification of the active metabolite.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the efavirenz due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the exemestane due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the enzymatic inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of fentanyl due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
Comment: Choose another opioid.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the fluconazole due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin

Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin; the consequences are particularly great in patients with Addisons disease treated with hydrocortisone and in cases of transplants
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the haloperidol and of its therapeutic effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of clinically low thyroid in patients with already low thyroid, due to increase of the metabolism of the T3 and of the T4.
Comment: Monitoring of serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormones during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of lower therapeutic effect of the hydroxychloroquine, due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoringand possible adjustment of the dosage of the hydroxychloroquine during the treatment with rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of idelalisib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer

Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the protease inhibitor, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.For the combination (saquinavir + ritonavir):risk of severe hepatocellular toxicity
Comment: Until additional data with the ritonavir boosted inhibitors is available.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the hepatoxicity of the isoniazid (increase of the formation of toxic metabolites of the isoniazid)
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring of this classic combination. In case of hepatitis, stop the isoniazid.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the ivabradine during the administration of the two substances together and after the rifampicin is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the two anti-infectives (enzymatic induction by the rifampicin and decrease of the intestinal absorption by the azole antifungal)
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the linezolide due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible increase of the dosage of the linezolide during the treatment with the rifampicin.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the beta blocking agent (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the metronidazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of metronidazole during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of absence of effect of the midazolam, with very large decrease of its plasma concentrations, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism

Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin; the consequences are particularly great in persons with Addison's disease treated with the hydrocortisone and in cases of organ transplants
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the montelukast due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antiasthmatic during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the morphine and of its active metabolite
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the morphine during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the nevirapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the calcium channel blocker due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the calcium channel blocker during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the nintedanib due to decrease of its absorption by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these medications together.

Description: Large decrease (up to two thirds) of the concentrations of perampanel
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the glitazone due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the glitazone during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the two anti-infectives (enzymatic induction by the rifampicin and decrease of the intestinal absorption by the azole antifungal)
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the praziquantal, with risk of failure of the treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the praziquantel by the rifampicin
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propafanone, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the administration of the two substances together and after the rifampicin is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the beta-blocking agent (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of quetiapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer, with risk of ineffectiveness
Risk of loss of the effectiveness of the quinine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the concentrations of the raltegravir by the rifampicin
Comment: If administering these together cannot be avoided, doubling the dose of raltegravir can be considered

Description: Very large decrease of the concentrations of ranolazine.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of rivaroxaban, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of simvastatin, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
Very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir

Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the telithromycin, with risk of failure of the anti-infective treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the telithromycin by the rifampicin.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to decrease of its absorption by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these medications together and 1 to 2 weeks after the rifampicin is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the terbinafine, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the terbinafine during the treatment with the rifampicin.

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the theophylline (increase of its metabolism by enzymatic induction)

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the tiagabine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: An increase of the dosage of the tiagabine can prove necessary in cases where it is administered with the rifampicin.

Description: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect.
Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
Comment: Choose a therapeutic alternative that is little or not at all metabolized.

Description: Risk of onset of convulsive crises, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the valproate by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the anticonvulsant during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the concentrations of vitamin D more marked than in the absence of the treatment with the rifampicin
Comment: Concentration dosage of vitamin D and supplementation if necessary.

Description: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the zolpidem due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the zopiclone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring. Possibly use another hypnotic.

Description: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the rilpivirine
Comment: If necessary, use an active H2 antagonist in one dose per day, to be taken at least 12 hours before or at least 4 hours after.

Risk of decrease of the plasma concentratons of rilpivirine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort

Drug 1 Class Name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)
Description: For anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1 g per dose and/or >= 3 g per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>= 500 mg per dose and/or <=3 gr per day):Acute renal insufficiency with dehydrated patients, due to decrease of the glomerular filtration following a decrease of the synthesis of the renal prostaglandins.Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
Comment: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment.

Drug 1 Class Name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)
Description: Risk of hyperkalemia, of renal insufficiency, of increase of mortality from cardiovascular disease
Comment: - for patients with diabetes or renal insufficiency

Drug 1 Class Name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)
Description: Acute renal insufficiency with patients at risk (older patient, dehydration, treatment with diuretics, changes in renal function), due to decrease of the glomerular filtration (inhibition of the vasodilater prostaglandins due to the non steroidal anti-inflammatories.) These effects are generally reversible. In addition, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
Comment: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment and regularly while these substances are administered together.

Drug 1 Class Name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

Description: In indications where the administration of these substances together is possible, increased risk of degradation of renal function, even acute renal insufficiency, and increase of the hyperkalemia as well as hypotension and fainting or loss of consciousness.

Description: Increase of the lithemia that can reach toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium)

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: --For dolasetron, erythromycin, spiramycin and vicamine, only the forms administerd by IV route are concerned by this interaction

Description: Risk of increase of the toxicity of these molecules due to decrease of their metabolism and/or increase of their bioavailability by the crizotinib
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the substrate due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the idealisib
Increase of the undesirable effects particular to each substrate, with frequently severe consequences
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the vitamin K antagonist
Comment: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the vitamin K antagonist (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the digoxin
Comment: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the digoxin (more that 2 hours apart, if possible).

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluorquinolones
Comment: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the fluoroquinolones (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the thyroid hormones.
Comment: Take the thyroid hormones at a different time from the sucralfate (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the phenytoin
Comment: Take the sucalfate at a different time from the phenytoin (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the sulpiride
Comment: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the sulpiride (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

Description: Increase of the opioid analgesics effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when there is also treatment with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4.

Description: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the antibiotic and a week after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin up to toxic values (inhibition of its metabolism)
Comment: The use of another class of antibiotic is preferred; if not, strict clinical monitoring, concentration dosage of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the sulfonamide antibiotic and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the antibiotic treatment and a week after it is stopped.

Description: Precipitation of crystals in the urinary tract (due to the acidification of the urine)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin up to toxic values (inhibition of its metabolism)
Comment: Another class of antibiotic should be used; if not, strict clinical monitoring, concentration dosage of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the antibacterial sulfonamide and after it is stopped.

Drug 2 Class Name: BETA BLOCKING AGENTS (EXCEPT ESMOLOL AND SOTALOL)
Description: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation, and electrical conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG

Description: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure
Large increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Comment: If the administration of the substances together cannot be avoided, more frequent testing of the INR and adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with cotrimoxazole and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin up to toxic values (inhibition of its metabolism)
Comment: Another class of antibiotic should be used; if not, strict clinical monitoring, concentration dosage of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the antibacterial sulfonamide and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the hematological toxicity of the methotrexate
Comment: Concentration dosage of methotrexate. Adjustment of the dosage if necessary during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

Description: Antabuse effect, especially for glibenclamide, glipizide, tolbutamide. Increase of the hypoglycemic reaction (inhibition of the compensation reactions) that can make possible the onset of hypoglycemic coma
Comment: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages and medications containing alcohol.

Description: Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia: decrease or increase of the need for the blood glucose lowering sufonamide, due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon
Comment: Reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog.

Drug 2 Class Name: BETA-2 MIMETICS or BETA 2 ADRENERGIC AGONISTS
Description: Elevation of the glycemia by the beta-2 mimetic
Comment: Reinforce blood and urine monitoring. Possibly change to insulin if the situation requires.

Description: All the beta blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
Comment: Inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, especially at the beginning of treatment.

Description: All the beta blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
Comment: Inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, especially at the beginning of the treatment.

Description: With large doses (100mg per day of chlorpromazine): elevation of the glycemia (decrease of the release of the insulin)
Comment: Inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the neuroleptic during the treatment and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetique
Comment: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the clarithromycin.

Description: Diabetes inducing effect of the danazol
Comment: If the administration of the substances together cannot be avoided, inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the antidiabetic during the treatment with the danazol and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the half life of the sulfonamide with possible onset of manifestations of hypoglymemia
Comment: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the sulfonamide during the treatment with the fluconazole.

Description: The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in diabetic patients treated with glucose lowering sulfonamides. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for the glucose lowering sulfonamides)
Comment: Reinforce self -monitoring of blood glucose.

Description: With the miconazole by general route or oral gel: increase of the hypoglycemic effect with possible onset of hypoglycemic manifestations, even coma
Decrease of the digoxinemia that can reach 50%
Comment: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly, monitoring of the digoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the sulfasalazine and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin due to increase of its metabolism by the sulfinpyrazone
Comment: Testing of blood concentrations of ciclosporin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with sulfinpyrazone and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the sulpiride
Comment: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the sulpiride (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

Description: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the thyroid hormones
Risk of lengthening of the motor block, increased in the case of partial deficit of pseudo-cholinesterase

Drug 2 Class Name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE
Description: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or rapid elevation of blood pressure

Drug 2 Class Name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE
Description: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Hypertensive crises (inhibition of the metabolism of the pressor amines). Because of the length of action of the MAOI, this interaction is still possible two weeks after the MAOI is stopped
Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or of rapid elevation of blood pressure

Drug 1 Class Name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)
Description: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increase of cardiac sensitization

Drug 1 Class Name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)
Description: Paroxysmal hypertension with the possibility of arrhythmias (inhibition of the entry of the sympathomimetic into the sympathic fiber)

Drug 1 Class Name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)
Description: Increase of the pressor action of the sympathomimetic, most often moderate.
Comment: Only use under strict medical monitoring.

Drug 1 Class Name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)
Drug 2 Class Name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE
Description: By extrapolation from the non selective MAOIs: risk of increase of the pressor action
Comment: To be used only under strict medical monitoring.

Drug 1 Class Name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)
Description: Paroxysmal hypertension with possibility of arrhythmias (inhibition of the entry of the sympathomimetic into the sympathic fiber)

Increase of the undesirable effects, and especially of metabolic acidosis, of the acetylsalicylic acid in large doses and of the acetazolamide, due to decrease of the elimination of the acetylsalicylic acid by the acetazolamide
Increase of hemorrhagic events

Drug 2 Class Name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)
Description: For anti-inflammatory dosages of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1g per dose and/or >=3g per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>=500mg by dose and/or <3g per day):Acute renal insufficiency with dehydrated patients, due to decrease of the glomerular filtration following a decrease of the synthesis of the renal prostaglandins. Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
Comment: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment.

Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage, especially in cases with a previous gastro duodenal ulcer.
Comment: -with anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1 g per dose and/or >= 3g per day)

Description: Increase of the risk of digestive system ulceration and hemorrhage.
Comment: -with anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1g per dose and/or >=3g per day)

Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage due to addition of the platelet aggregation activities.
Comment: -except in validated indications for this combination of drugs in acute coronary syndromes.

Description: With anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1g per dose and/or >=3g per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>=500 mg per dose and/or <3 g per day):increase of the risk of digestive ulceration and hemorrhage

For anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1g per dose and/or >=3g per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>=500 mg per dose and/or <3 g per day):Acute renal insufficiency in dehydrated patients, due to decrease of the glomerular filtration as a result of a decrease of the synthesis of the renal prostaglandins. Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
Comment: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the start of treatment.

Drug 2 Class Name: GLUCOCORTICOIDS (EXCEPT FOR HYDROCORTISONE IN REPLACEMENT THERAPY)

Drug 2 Class Name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENT)
Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage (inhibition of the platelet function and irritation of the gastro duodenal mucosa by the acetylsalicylic acid)
Comment: -with anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1g per dose and/or >=3 g per day)

Drug 2 Class Name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (PREVENTIVE DOSES)
Description: The combination of medications acting at different levels of hemostasis increases the risk of bleeding. Thus, with patients under the age of 65, adding heparin in preventive doses to acetylsalicylic acid, whatever the dosage, must be taken into account by maintaining clinical monitoring and possibly biological monitoring.

Drug 2 Name: UNFRACTIONATED HEPARIN (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENTS)
Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage (inhibition of the platelet function and irritation of the gastro duodenal mucosa by the acetylsalicylic acid)
Comment: -with anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1g per dose and/or >=3 g per day)

Description: The combination of medications acting at different levels of hemostasis increases the risk of bleeding. Thus, with patients under the age of 65, adding preventive doses of heparin or similar substances to acetylsalicylic acid, regardless of the dosage, must be taken into account by maintaining clinical monitoring and possibly biological monitoring

For anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1g per dose and/or >=3g per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>=500 mg per dose and/or <3 g per day):Acute renal insufficiency in dehydrated patients, due to decreased glomerular filtration following a decrease of the synthesis of the renal prostaglandins. Description: Disorders of autoregulation and of cardiac conduction with risk of excessive bradycardia

Description: Increase of the digoxinemia
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring, and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the telaprevir and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the effectiveness of the estrogen
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration of the telaprevir and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the telaprevir
Comment: Use an additional or alternative, reliable contraceptive method during the administration of the substances together and two cycles after.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the telaprevir
Comment: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of its dosage during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of telaprevir and of the itraconazole
Comment: Clinical monitoring. Avoid large doses of itraconaole (>200 mg per day).

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of medazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation

Description: Risk of very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir
Very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin)

Increased risk of undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering medication

Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption

Description: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism

Description: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to decrease of its absorption by the inducer

Description: With the atazanavir, the darunavir or the lopinavir, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption

Description: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tenofovir alafenamide due to decrease of its intracellular activity by the telaprevir

Description: Risk of increase of the nephrotoxicity of the tenofovir, especially with large doses of the anti-inflammatory or in the presence of factors of risk of renal insufficiency.

Description: Decrease by about a third of the exposure to the atazanavir in patients who are also taking tenofovir, compared to a healthy subject receiving the same substances together

Description: Risk of failure of the antiretroviral treatment, even emergence of resistance. In addition, increase of the risk of the mitochondrial toxicity of the didanosine
When co-administered with a protease inhibitor, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir by the ledipasvir

Comment: Testing of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with terbinafine and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine
