Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially hematological ones, of the zidovudine due to decrease of its metabolism by the valproic acid.
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring. A CBC checking for anemia should be done during the course of the first two months of the administration of these substances together.

Description: Increase of the hyperammonemia, with accued risk of encephalopathy
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the vardenafil, with risk of hypotension.
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the bupropion, with increase of its active metabolite and increased toxicity
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the combined estrogen-progestin contraceptive with the consequence of a risk of ineffectiveness
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the ifosfamide, with increase of its active metabolite and increased toxicity
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the immunosuppressants, with the consequence of a risk of ineffectiveness
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the vemurafenib, with lower effectiveness
Large increase of the concentrations of theophylline, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with vemurafenib and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the anticonvulsant.
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose.
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Risk of appearance of convulsions and/or of a serotonin syndrome
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the verapamil
Comment: It is recommended that the verapamil be administered as far as possible from the afatinib, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours distant from the dose of afatinib.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects
Comment: Clinical monitoring.

Description: For verapamil by injection:--risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular blockFor verapamil by mouth:--risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older persons
Comment: --the verapamil via IV

Description: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering medication
Comment: Use weaker doses of the cholesterol lowering medication. If the therapeutic objective is not reached, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

Description: Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and cardiac failure
Comment: The administration of these medications together should only be undertaken under strict clinical monitoring and EKG, in particular with older patients or at the beginning of treatment.

Description: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure, disorders of autoregulation (bradycardia, sinus arrest) and disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil, with increase of its undesirable effects
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buspirone if necessary.

Description: Increase of the blood concentrations of the ciclosporin (decrease of its hepatic metabolism), and increase of the risk of gum disorders.
Comment: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

Description: Disorders of autoregulation (disorders of atrioventricular conduction due to addition of the negative effects on conduction)
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, due to increase of its plasma concentrations by the verapamil
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Comment: In a post surgical indication: clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the dabigatran to 150 mg/day in one dose, or even 75 mg/day in case of moderate renal insufficiency

Description: With the dantrolene administered by IV: with animals, fatal cases of ventricular fibrillations are constantly observed when verapamil and dantrolene are administered by IV route. The administration of a calcium channel blocker and dantrolene together is thus potentially dangerous. However, some patients have received nifedipine and dantrolene together without incident.

Excessive bradycardia and atrioventricular block due to increase of the effects of the digoxin on autoregulation and conduction and due to decrease of the renal and extrarenal elimination of the digoxin
Comment: Clinical monitoring, EKG and, possibly, testing of the digoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the verapamil and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the doxorubicin due to increase of its plasma concentrations

Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the calcium channel blocker
Comment: Start the treatment by the calcium channel blocker with the lowest recommended dosages, and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of eribuline by the verapamil.
Bradycardia and/or disorders of atrioventricular conduction, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the verapamil by the erythromycin
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG, if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the verapamil during the treatment with the erythromycin and after it is stopped.

Description: Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and cardiac failure
Comment: -in case of alteration of the left ventricular function.

Description: Increase of the blood concentrations of the everolimus due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil
Comment: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the two medications together and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of ibrutinib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil
Comment: Strict clinical monitoring and reduction of the dose of ibrutinib to 140 mg per day during the length of the administration of the two medications together.

Description: Bradycardia and/or disorders of atrioventricular conduction, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the verapamil by the inhibitor
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the verapamil during the treatment with the inhibitor, and after it is stopped, as the situation requires.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil), that add to the bradycardia inducing effects of these molecules.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam (decrease of its hepatic metabolism with increase of sedation).
Comment: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of midazolam during the treatment with the verapamil.

Description: Large reduction of the concentrations of verapamil, with risk of loss of its therapeutic effect.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the nintedanib due to increase of it absorption by the verapamil
Comment: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these substances together

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of olaparib by the verapamil
Comment: If administering these together cannot be avoided, limit the dose of olaparib to 200 mg twice a day.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of verapamil, with risk of the appearance of undesirable effects
Risk of large increase of the hemodynamic effects of the verapamil, with severe hypotension and bradycardia
Increased risk of undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering agent
Comment: Do not exceed the dosage of 20mg/day of simvastatin or use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

Description: Increase of the blood concentrations of the sirolimus (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil).
Comment: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

Description: Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil)
Comment: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosine, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosine during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped, if the situation requires.

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
Comment: In case of co-administration with the verapamil, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10mg per day.

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Increased risk of neurological disorders (trembling, confusion) due to partial inhibition of the metabolism of the antiviral
Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the clarithromycin
Comment: Strict clinical and biological monitoring. Possibly, use another antibiotic.

Description: Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cobicistat
Comment: Strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antimitotic.

Description: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the erythromycin
Comment: Strict clinical and biological monitoring. Possibly, use another antibiotic.

Description: Increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor.
Comment: Strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antimitotic.

Description: Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole
Risk of increase of the pulmonary toxicity of the mitomycin and of the vinca alkaloids
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the posaconazole
Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism of the telithromycin
Comment: Strict clinical and biological monitoring. Possibly, use another antibiotic.

Description: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of vismodegib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of vismodegib
In case of intake of 10,000 IU/day and more: risk of intracranial hypertension
Risk of symptoms evocative of hypervitaminosis A
Decrease of the concentrations of vitamin D more noticeable than in the absence of the inducer
Comment: Concentration dosage of vitamin D and supplementation if necessary.

Description: Decrease of the absorption of the vitamin D
Decrease of the concentrations of vitamin D more noticeable than in the absence of treatment with the rifampacin
Comment: Concentration dosage of vitamin D and supplementation if necessary.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes, due to possible decrease of the metabolism of the amiodarone.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and EKG, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the amiodarone.

Description: --for carbamazepine, phenobarbital, primidone: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer--for phenytoin, fosphenytoin: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenytoin, for one thing; and increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenytoin due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole, for another.
Comment: --for carbamazepine, phenobarbital, primidone

Description: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with voriconazole and a week after it is stopped.

Description: In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route:increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome even of adrenal insufficiency
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamthasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye)
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the efavirenz
Comment: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole and of the efavirenz during the administration of the two together.

Description: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the glipizide at the origin of potentially severe hypoglycemia
Comment: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during and after the treatment with voriconazole.

Description: Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole.
Comment: --with the everolimus, the sirolimus, and the temsirolimus

Description: Very large reduction of the concentrations of the antifungal due to increase of its metabolism by the ritonavir, with risk of failure of the treatment
Significant reduction of the concentrations of voriconazole, with risk of loss of its therapeutic effect
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the nevirapine
Comment: If the administration of the substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole during the administration of the substances together.

Description: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifabutin for one thing, and risk of increase of the undesirable effects (uveitis) of the rifabutin for another.
Comment: If the administration of the substances together is judged necessary, clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole (generally doubled) during the treatment with the rifabutin.

Description: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose.
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the vortioxetine due to large decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the treatment with cinacalcet and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the vortioxetine by decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the treatment with the fluoxetine and after it is stopped.

Description: Reduction of the plasma concentrations of the vortioxetine
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the administration with the inducer and 1 to 2 weeks after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the vortioxetine due to large decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the viortioxetine during the treatment with the paroxetine and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the vortioxetine due to large decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring andpossible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the treatment with the quinidine and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the vortioxetine due to large decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the treatment with the terbinafine and after it is stopped

Description: Possible inhibition of the antihypertensive activity due to antagonism at the level of the receptors
Risk of general vaccine disease, possibly fatal.
Comment: --belimumab, blinatumomab, canakinumab, obinutuzumab, ofatumumab, rituximab, tocilizumab, ustekinumab

Description: Increased risk of onset of pancreatitis and of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
Comment: Regular clinical monitoring and monitoring of the amylasemia. Do not administer these substances together if the amylasemia is at the high range of normal.

Description: Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two medications together.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
Increased risk of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral, due to inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

Description: With the amphotericin B administered intravenously:increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)
Comment: More frequent CBC.

Description: Increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)
Comment: More frequent CBC

Description: Increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)
Comment: More frequent CBC

Description: Increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)
Comment: Stop the zidovudine temporarily; CBC, and reintroduce, if possible, the zidovudine in weak doses.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral, due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the medications together.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral, due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially hematological ones, of the zidovudine due to decrease of its metabolism by the valproic acid
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring. A CBC checking for anemia should be done during the course of the first two months of the administration of these substances together.

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the zinc by the calcium
Comment: Take the calcium salts at a different time from the zinc (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the tetracycline antibiotics
Comment: Take the zinc salts at a different time from the tetracycline antibiotics (more than two hours apart if possible).

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the zinc by the iron
Comment: Take the iron salts at a different time from the zinc (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

Description: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
Comment: Take the zinc salts at a different time from the fluoroquinlones (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

Description: Decease of the digestive absorption of the strontium
Comment: Take the strontium at a different time from the zinc salts (more than two hours apart if possible).

Description: Slight increase of the sedative effect of the zolpidem
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the zolpidem due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring. Possibly use another hypnotic.

Description: Increase of the hyperammonemia, with increased risk of encephalopathy
Comment: Regular clinical and biological monitoring.

Description: Slight increase of the sedative effect of the zopiclone
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the zopiclone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Comment: Clinical monitoring.Possibly use another hypnotic.

Description: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increased cardiac sensitization.
Comment: Limit the amount of adrenaline, for example: less than 0.1 mg of adrenalin in 10 minutes or 0.3 mg in an hour for an adult

Description: Risk of increase of the muscular hypotonia.
Vasodilator effect and risk of hypotension, especially orthostatic (additive effect)
Described for desipramine, imipramine: inhibition of the antihypertensive effect of the clonidine (antagonism at the level of the adrenergic receptors)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tricyclic antidepressant with risk of convulsions and increase of the undesirable effects
Comment: Increased clinical monitoring and, if necessary, adjustment of the dosage

Description: Risk of therapeutic failure in cases of concomitant treatment with orlistat

Drug 2 Class Name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine with potentially fatal consequences
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmia, especially of torsades de pointes
Comment: If it is possible, interrupt the azole antifungal. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT before the beginning of the treatment and EKG monitoring

Description: Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation.
Comment: -midazolam IV route

Description: Increase of the hypotensive effect. Risk of severe orthostatic hypotension
Increase of the hypotensive effect. Greater risk of orthostatic hypotension. .
Risk of orthostatic hypotension, especially with older patients
Comment: -with the doxazosine

Description: Large increase of blood pressure in cases of sudden termination of the treatment with the central antihypertensive
Comment: Avoid ending treatment with the central antihypertensive abruptly. Clinical monitoring.

Description: Central decrease of the sympathetic tone and vasodilator effect of the central antihypertensives, dangerous in case of heart failure treated with a beta-blocking agent and vasodilator
With large doses of ascorbic acid and by intravenous route: cardiac function anomalies, even acute heart failure (generally reversible by ending the administration of the Vitamin C).
Comment: In the case of hemochromatosis, only give Vitamin C after having started the treatment with the deferoxamine. Monitor cardiac function when these substances are administered together.

Description: Increase of the hypotensive effect. Risk of greater orthostatic hypotension
Increase of the hypotensive effect. Greater risk of orthostatic hypotension
With the other non steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs: increase of the risk of causing ulcers and digestive hemorrhage
Increase of the risk of digestive system ulceration and hemorrhage
Comment: -anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1gr per dose and/or >=3gr per day)

Drug 2 Class Name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)
Description: Acute renal insufficiency with patients at risk (older patient, dehydration, treatment with diuretics, changes in renal function), due to decrease of the glomerular filtration (inhibition of the vasodilator prostaglandins due to the non-steroidal anti-inflammatories). These effects are generally reversible. In addition, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
Comment: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment and regularly while these substances are administered together.

Description: Increase of the oral anticoagulants risk of hemorrhage (irritation of the gastroduodenal mucosa by the non-steroidal anti-inflammatories)
Comment: -with phenylbutazone

Description: Reduction of the antihypertensive effect (inhibition of the vasodilating prostaglandins by the non steroidal anti-inflammatories and fluid retention with the phenylbutazone
Risk of addition of the nephrotoxic effects, especially with older patients.
Comment: Monitor renal function at the beginning of the treatment with the NSAI

Description: Increase of the risk of causing ulcers and digestive hemorrhage

Acute renal insufficiency with the patient at risk (older patient and/or dehydrated one) due to decrease of the glomerular filtration (inhibition of the vasodilator prostaglandins due to the NSAIs). Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect
Comment: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the start of treatment

Description: Increase of the risk of ulceration and of gastrointestinal hemorrhage

Drug 2 Class Name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENT)
Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage (irritation of the gastroduodenal mucosa by the NSAIs)
Comment: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring

Drug 2 Class Name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (PREVENTIVE DOSES)
Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage

Drug 2 Class Name: UNFRACTIONATED HEPARIN (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENTS)

Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage

These effects are generally reversible. Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
Comment: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment and regularly during the administration of the substances together.

Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Increase of the lithemia that can reach toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium)
Comment: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, monitor the lithemia strictly and adjust the dosage of the lithium during the treatment with the substances together and after the NSAI is stopped

Description: Increase of the hematological toxicity of the methotrexate (decrease of the renal clearance of the methotrexate by the NSAIs).
Comment: -with the phenylbutazone, regardless of the dose of methotrexate and for all the forms of phenylbutazone, including topical.

Description: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the pemetrexed (decrease of its renal clearance by the NSAIs)

Description: Increase of the risk of hemorrage
Risk of addition of the nephrotoxic effects, especially with older patients

Description: Risk of increase of the nephrotoxicity of the tenofovir, especially with large doses of the anti-inflammatory or in the presence of factors of risk of renal insufficiency
Comment: When these are administered together, monitor renal function.

Drug 2 Class Name: SUBSTANCES THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

Comment: with citalopram, domperidone, escitalopram, hydroxyzine and piperaquine

Description: Reciprocal antagonism of the dopaminergic and the neuroleptics. The dopaminergic can cause or aggravate the psychotic disorders. When a treatment with neuroleptics is necessary for a Parkinsons patient treated with dopaminergics, these latter must be decreased progressively until they are stopped (their abrupt discontinuation exposes the patient to a risk of "neuroleptic malignant syndrome" (NMS)).
Decrease of the effect of the Vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism

Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the intragastric pH by the antisecretory
Decrease of the concentrations of ledipasvir when the proton pump inhibitor is administered before the ledipasvir
Comment: It is recommended that the proton pump inhibitor and the ledipasvir be taken simultaneously.

Comment: -with the methotrexate in doses > 20mg /week

Increase of the immunodepression

Description: Reduction of the compensatory cardiovascular reactions by the beta-blocking agents. The beta-adrenergic inhibition can be elevated during the surgical procedure by the beta-mimetics

Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and heart failure
Comment: The administration of these medications together should only be done under clinical monitoring and strict EKG, in particular with older patients or at the beginning of treatment.

Description: Decrease of the effectiveness of the estrogen.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration with the boceprevir.

Description: Aside from the combination with ethinylestradiol (0.035mg)/noresthisterone (1mg), risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism by the hormonal contraceptive by the boceprevir
Comment: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the time these medications are taken together.

Description: Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant (substantial for the ciclosporin, extremely large for the tacrolimus)
Comment: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

Description: Decrease of the concentrations of the boceprevir and of the lopinavir (or darunavir or fosamprenavir), with risk of therapeutic failure
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone, with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the boceprevir
Comment: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

Description: Aside from the combination with ethinylestradiol (0.035mg)/noresthisterone (1mg), risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the boceprevir
Comment: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the time these medications are taken together.

Description: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of boceprevir
Comment: If administering these together cannot be avoided, regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of treatment with the two medications together.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the tenefovir alafenamide by decrease of its intracellular activity by the boceprevir
Decrease of the concentrations of the cytotoxic due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer, with risk of lower effectiveness
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially neurological, of the bortezomib due to decrease of its metabolism.
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the bortezomib during the length of the treatment with the enzymatic inhibitor.

Description: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Comment: More frequent testing of INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist.

Description: Large decrease of the blood concentrations of the ciclosporin and increase of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cyproterone
Comment: In its indications such as anti-androgen, clinical monitoring and if possible adjustment of the dosage of the cyproterone during the administratin with the bosentan and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive
Comment: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the length of time the two substances are administered together and for a cycle after.

Description: Risk of reduced effectiveness of the glibenclamide due to decrease of its plasma concentrations, because of the inducer effect of the bosentan. Furthermore, cases of hepotoxicity have been reported with these two substances administered together.
Comment: Monitoring of the glycemia, adjustment of the treatment if needed, and monitoring of the hepatic biological constants.

Description: Increased risk of the undesirable effects of the bosantan, especially hepatic attacks, due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
Comment: Clinical and biological monitoring during the administration of these together.

Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive due to increase of its hepatic metabolism.
Comment: Use an additional or alternative reliable method of contraception during the time these substances are administered together and one cycle following

Drug 2 Class Name: NON-CONTRACEPTIVE PROGESTOGENS, COMBINED WITH AN ESTROGEN OR NOT
Description: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the progestogen
Comment: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration of the bosentan and after it is stopped.

Description: Risk of decrease, large for the rifampicin, of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
